[NetApp] Fix share shrink error status

This patch fixes the error raised by NetApp driver when the user try
to shrink a share to a size smaller than the current used space. Now
the driver raises "shrinking_possible_data_loss" instead of
"shrinking_error".

commit_message:
[NetApp] Fix share replica failing for 'transfer in progress' error

This patch fix an issue in NetApp driver share replica periodic
check that erroneuouly set a share replica to error after receiving
a 'Another transfer is in progress' error. The driver now skips the
resync operation for all expected transfer in progress relationship
status.

Closes-Bug: #1848889
Change-Id: If82aaa184db84660389f82654279f3c5b238fd51
(cherry picked from commit 572be43bb03a67376b52a11c70e587eb160b68a3)
(cherry picked from commit cc2dea14a514ad1a7025d904074307817c60e3ce)
(cherry picked from commit 48f3e09d12f38084a16309360fd2fbdddd441c4f)

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2020-04-22 09:00:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> (1 comment)

To be less peremptory, I like the idea of storing the current config "somewhere", it's just not clear why we have to store it somewhere else than podman. As weird as it looks, it guarantess that the running container always keep a trace of the config hash it has consumed.

If we want to split that, could we e.g.:
  1. store this "previous config" somewhere else, and let ansible store it
  2. do it for all other containers for consistency

Or maybe I miss the whole point?'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2020-04-22 09:30:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

OK I see now why we need to save the container hash somewhere: because otherwise we have no means of calling "restart_bundle" only when the config has changed.
(that's because unless non-HA containers, we don't store the hash in HA containers because we don't create the containers directly. pacemaker does)'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-04-22 15:05:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

Let's keep this one around but we won't be using it unless something changes in our plans"}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-05-01 14:17:20.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
WIP Keep hash of config of previous run around

This is useful in deployment_tasks to detect if the config has changed
compared to the previous run and it avoids having to look for that
info in podman inspect.

Change-Id: Ie16f42138d039e43df517467532aaa58f0b5f1db
Related-Bug: #1863442

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie13f0c75090d707a60d9b886d436bbbcd07066a5

commit_message:
Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: Id27c5ad8a9d4a00f37d4a3ff7f8a71780df50fb0
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: I3548e78806a925c95641f9de355edd12971ea620
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Pin sh library used for molecule tests

This pin works for python2 and python3 environments
and resolves:

https://github.com/ansible-community/molecule/issues/2676

We unfortunately have molecule pinned, so we won't
inherit any fixes (including this one) from newer
releases.

Change-Id: I0548b0a20abbc8a0c0ac3c7d88c93c0180a87a77

subject: Add a method to prevent an ip being set on an interface
messages:
[{'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2020-03-05 16:37:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2020-03-05 16:39:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

No more dummy networks.'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2020-03-05 16:41:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

nit: Do we need to update docs and add a release note for people that have used dummy networks?'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2020-03-05 16:49:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> nit: Do we need to update docs and add a release note for people
 > that have used dummy networks?

Docs are needed anyway to explain how to use it. Release note would be nice too.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-03-05 16:52:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Is the real issue here that the interfaces role should apply an MTU to slaves as well as the master?'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-03-05 16:55:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

> No more dummy networks.

I don't think it avoids dummy networks always. They're useful for plugging bonds into bridges, and other things."}, {'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2020-03-05 16:57:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2 Workflow-1

This didn't seem to work. Maybe we do need to set the mtu on the bond slaves in the interfaces role."}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2020-03-05 17:04:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

I suppose this problem goes away if you use a native VLAN for one of the VLANs you want on the bond, and then you can set the MTU for that VLAN on the base interface. Could be a pain if you wanted different MTUs.'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2020-03-05 17:05:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Well, not quite sure if that will work yet, but for a single interface it does.'}, {'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2020-04-27 11:58:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck - this did seem useful for the case for bonds where there was no native vlan.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-04-27 12:07:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> recheck - this did seem useful for the case for bonds where there
 > was no native vlan.

Still needs docs :)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-04-27 12:12:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

Should this flag also affect IP allocation, to avoid allocating an IP address?'}, {'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2020-04-29 15:46:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Here is my config for setting mtu for a bond:

  bonded_storage_mtu: 9000
  bonded_storage_noip: true

  storage_extra_network_interfaces:
    - bonded_storage

  bonded_storage_interface: bondstr

  storage_slave1_interface: enp95s0f0
  storage_slave2_interface: enp95s0f1
  storage_slave3_interface: enp216s0f0
  storage_slave4_interface: enp216s0f1


  bonded_storage_bond_slaves:
    - "{{ storage_slave1_interface }}"
    - "{{ storage_slave2_interface }}"
    - "{{ storage_slave3_interface }}"
    - "{{ storage_slave4_interface }}"

Is this a reasonable solution?'}, {'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2020-04-29 15:53:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Just to clarify, then all the network interface defintions that use this bond are vlan subinterface i.e there is no native vlan:

  storage_net_interface: "{{ bonded_storage_interface }}.{{ storage_net_vlan }}"
  storage_net_mtu: 9000

  storage_mgmt_net_interface: "{{ bonded_storage_interface }}.{{ storage_mgmt_net_vlan }}"
  storage_mgmt_net_mtu: 9000'}, {'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2020-04-29 15:56:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Maybe you are right. We could set the MTU on the bond as the max of the slave MTUs in the interfaces role. Would that work?'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-04-30 19:52:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I just tried to reproduce your setup using a seed hypervisor.

group_vars/seed-hypervisor:

vlan42_interface: bond0.42
vlan43_interface: bond0.43
bond_interface: bond0
bond_bond_slaves:
  - dummy-slave-0
  - dummy-slave-1

networks.yml:

vlan42_vlan: 42
vlan42_cidr: 10.42.0.0/24
vlan42_mtu: 9000

vlan43_vlan: 43
vlan43_cidr: 10.43.0.0/24
vlan43_mtu: 9000

bond_mtu: 9000

seed-hypervisor.yml:

seed_hypervisor_extra_network_interfaces:
  - vlan42
  - vlan43
  - bond

I created the dummy interfaces for the bond slaves like this:

sudo ip l add dummy-slave-0 type dummy
sudo ip l add dummy-slave-1 type dummy

They had the 9k MTU applied:

8: bond0: <NO-CARRIER,BROADCAST,MULTICAST,MASTER,UP> mtu 9000 qdisc noqueue state DOWN mode DEFAULT group default qlen 1000                                                                                
    link/ether 12:44:3d:0b:57:f6 brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff qdisc noqueue state LOWERLAYERDOWN mode DEFAULT group default qlen 1000                                                                   
    link/ether 12:44:3d:0b:57:f6 brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff
11: bond0.43@bond0: <NO-CARRIER,BROADCAST,MULTICAST,UP> mtu 9000 qdisc noqueue state LOWERLAYERDOWN mode DEFAULT group default qlen 1000                                                                   
    link/ether 12:44:3d:0b:57:f6 brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff
12: dummy-slave-1: <BROADCAST,NOARP> mtu 1500 qdisc noop state DOWN mode DEFAULT group default qlen 1000                                                                                                   
    link/ether 0e:01:c3:ff:d7:69 brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff
13: dummy-slave-2: <BROADCAST,NOARP> mtu 1500 qdisc noop state DOWN mode DEFAULT group default qlen 1000                                                                                                   
    link/ether de:8e:8e:6a:5c:c4 brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff'}, {'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2020-05-01 08:36:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

But the bond has the address 0.0.0.0, right? From what I can remember if you have more than one such bond on the network. If you do a systemctl restart network, it will detect the duplicate IP and refuse to start.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-05-01 11:15:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It just doesn't have an address:

20: bond0: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST,MASTER,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 9000 qdisc noqueue state UP group default qlen 1000
    link/ether ae:45:a1:8c:5d:53 brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff
    inet6 fe80::ac45:a1ff:fe8c:5d53/64 scope link 
       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-05-01 11:35:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> It just doesn't have an address:
 > 
 > 20: bond0: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST,MASTER,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 9000 qdisc
 > noqueue state UP group default qlen 1000
 > link/ether ae:45:a1:8c:5d:53 brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff
 > inet6 fe80::ac45:a1ff:fe8c:5d53/64 scope link
 > valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever

Made a second bond, no problemo

28: bond2: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST,MASTER,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 9000 qdisc noqueue state UP group default qlen 1000
    link/ether 72:a3:91:7f:90:3c brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff
    inet6 fe80::70a3:91ff:fe7f:903c/64 scope link 
       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever"}, {'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2020-05-01 13:03:19.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

OK, thanks Mark. Seems this is unnecessary then. Not quite sure how I hit the issue I did, but with the time pressure I forgot to collect any logs *facepalm*.'}]

This can be used to set the MTU on interfaces that make up

Change-Id: I7ca5e5905887fb0ecdb34f9f44d0e669ca79906b
'}]
commit_message:
Add a method to prevent an ip being set on an interface

This can be used to set the MTU on interfaces that make up
a bond.

Change-Id: I7ca5e5905887fb0ecdb34f9f44d0e669ca79906b

commit_message:
compute: Add stable device rescue tests with BFV instances

This change introduces tests for stable device rescue with boot from
volume instances using blank, image and snapshot based volumes.

Change-Id: Ic5e38c6da710e1e5fb40b186d8da537eef48b1a5

Adapt to Octavia Certificate Configuration Guide.

This patch updates the octavia controller deployment to use the
latest octavia certificate configuration guide [1]. The dual CA changes
were introduced in Train.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-24 22:51:22.000000000', 'message': "Lowercase ironic driver hash ring and ignore case in cache

Recently we had a customer case where attempts to add new ironic nodes
to an existing undercloud resulted in half of the nodes failing to be
detected and added to nova. Ironic API returned all of the newly added
nodes when called by the driver, but half of the nodes were not
returned to the compute manager by the driver.

There was only one nova-compute service managing all of the ironic
nodes of the all-in-one typical undercloud deployment.

After days of investigation and examination of a database dump from the
customer, we noticed that at some point the customer had changed the
hostname of the machine from something containing uppercase letters to
the same name but all lowercase. The nova-compute service record had
the mixed case name and the CONF.host (socket.gethostname()) had the
lowercase name.

The hash ring logic adds all of the nova-compute service hostnames plus
CONF.host to hash ring, then the ironic driver reports only the nodes
it owns by retrieving a service hostname from the ring based on a hash
of each ironic node UUID.

Because of the machine hostname change, the hash ring contained, for
example: {'MachineHostName', 'machinehostname'} when it should have
contained only one hostname. And because the hash ring contained two
hostnames, the driver was able to retrieve only half of the nodes as
nodes that it owned. So half of the new nodes were excluded and not
added as new compute nodes.

This adds lowercasing of hosts that are added to the hash ring and
ignores case when comparing the CONF.host to the hash ring members
to avoid unnecessary pain and confusion for users that make hostname
changes that are otherwise functionally harmless.

This also adds logging of the set of hash ring members at level DEBUG
to help enable easier debugging of hash ring related situations.

Closes-Bug: #1866380

 Conflicts:
	nova/virt/ironic/driver.py

NOTE(melwitt): Conflict is because change
I1b184ff37948dc403fe38874613cd4d870c644fd is not in Rocky.

Change-Id: I617fd59de327de05a198f12b75a381f21945afb0
(cherry picked from commit 7145100ee4e732caa532d614e2149ef2a545287a)
(cherry picked from commit 588b0484bf6f5fe41514f1428aeaf5613635e35a)
(cherry picked from commit 8f8667a8dd0e453eaef8f75a3fff25db62d4cc17)
"}]
commit_message:
Lowercase ironic driver hash ring and ignore case in cache

Recently we had a customer case where attempts to add new ironic nodes
to an existing undercloud resulted in half of the nodes failing to be
detected and added to nova. Ironic API returned all of the newly added
nodes when called by the driver, but half of the nodes were not
returned to the compute manager by the driver.

There was only one nova-compute service managing all of the ironic
nodes of the all-in-one typical undercloud deployment.

After days of investigation and examination of a database dump from the
customer, we noticed that at some point the customer had changed the
hostname of the machine from something containing uppercase letters to
the same name but all lowercase. The nova-compute service record had
the mixed case name and the CONF.host (socket.gethostname()) had the
lowercase name.

The hash ring logic adds all of the nova-compute service hostnames plus
CONF.host to hash ring, then the ironic driver reports only the nodes
it owns by retrieving a service hostname from the ring based on a hash
of each ironic node UUID.

Because of the machine hostname change, the hash ring contained, for
example: {'MachineHostName', 'machinehostname'} when it should have
contained only one hostname. And because the hash ring contained two
hostnames, the driver was able to retrieve only half of the nodes as
nodes that it owned. So half of the new nodes were excluded and not
added as new compute nodes.

This adds lowercasing of hosts that are added to the hash ring and
ignores case when comparing the CONF.host to the hash ring members
to avoid unnecessary pain and confusion for users that make hostname
changes that are otherwise functionally harmless.

This also adds logging of the set of hash ring members at level DEBUG
to help enable easier debugging of hash ring related situations.

Closes-Bug: #1866380

 Conflicts:
	nova/virt/ironic/driver.py

NOTE(melwitt): Conflict is because change
I1b184ff37948dc403fe38874613cd4d870c644fd is not in Rocky.

Change-Id: I617fd59de327de05a198f12b75a381f21945afb0
(cherry picked from commit 7145100ee4e732caa532d614e2149ef2a545287a)
(cherry picked from commit 588b0484bf6f5fe41514f1428aeaf5613635e35a)
(cherry picked from commit 8f8667a8dd0e453eaef8f75a3fff25db62d4cc17)

horizon recently switched from the third-party mock to unittest.mock.
This breaks heat-dashboard unit tests somehow.
We no longer support py27 and we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module. Rather than investigating the cause of

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

horizon recently switched from the third-party mock to unittest.mock.
This breaks heat-dashboard unit tests somehow.
We no longer support py27 and we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module. Rather than investigating the cause of
the failure, it would be nice to switch to unittest.mock.

horizon dependency is updated to 18.3.1 as unittest.mock is used
since 18.3.0 and 18.3.0 has an issue that it always requires pytest.
lower-constraints is updated to match horizon requirements.

hacking local-check-factory is disabled temporarily due to
the incompatibility with hacking 2.0 or later.
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715690/ will recover it.

Change-Id: I517d6d7d36410c64bf48ad958b3e2115725a6491
(cherry picked from commit bd68639408372c938766bc53c6cc305b8a9743ce)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-15 12:04:57.000000000', 'message': "Parametrize patch strip option in workarounds.

Right now, all the workarounds are patched using the strip option
--p set to 1. That works in most of the cases, but for some directories
/projects it's needed to pass a different strip value (tripleo-ansible)

commit_message:
Parametrize patch strip option in workarounds.

Right now, all the workarounds are patched using the strip option
--p set to 1. That works in most of the cases, but for some directories
/projects it's needed to pass a different strip value (tripleo-ansible)
causing all workarounds to not been applied.

This patch adds a new workarounds option patch_strip which accepts an
integer and will set the -p option at the time of applying the workaround.
If the option is not passed, the default value will be 1.

Change-Id: I0cb5d26838cf38bb04e22cfa3a06e06177eebd55

commit_message:
[Community goal] Update contributor documentation

As the Ussuri goal we have an OpenStack project wide contributing
documentation template [1]. os-vif use its own bug or feature
tracking LP and core team is also not exactly same as nova so adding
its own contributor guide with keeping common links from nova
with os-vif specific information.

Also the top level CONTRIBUTING.rst template has been changed in the
cookiecutter repo[2]. So this patch updates the CONTRIBUTING.rst according
to the new template.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/cookiecutter/src/branch/master/%7b%7bcookiecutter.repo_name%7d%7d/$
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/696001

Change-Id: I6017fdbb403d4cd90f4c3c2bd4a197dfbb67f6ec
Story: #2007236
Task: #38541

commit_message:
Add support for encrypting Horizon and Placement API

This patch introduces an optional backend encryption for Horizon and
Placement services. When used in conjunction with enabling TLS for
service API endpoints, network communcation will be encrypted end to
end, from client through HAProxy to the Horizon and Placement services.

Change-Id: I9cb274141c95aea20e733baa623da071b30acf2d
Partially-Implements: blueprint add-ssl-internal-network

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I3456e8fd7e3a24d4dd60454f11c934232fe399cf

commit_message:
FFWD automation for HA and composable environments

We need to run in quite tedious order to upgrade properly
the Pacemaker managed roles. First we split the environment
into Pacemaker enabled, Non-Pacemaker Non-Compute and Compute
groups of roles:

Pacemaker: ['Controller','Database','Messaging']
Non-Pacemaker&Non-Compute: ['Ceph','Networking','Objectstorage']
Compute: ['Compute','OSDCompute']

For Pacemaker we have to upgrade one of each roles in the Pacemaker
group together - controller-0,database-0,messaging-0 to ensure that
upgrade will work. We can run system upgrade in parallel on them
too.

The tricky part with Pacemaker is that than we need to run upgrade
on the one node of each role in the Pacemaker group but also on all
previous Pacemaker nodes to ensure we don't create several separated
clusters.

For the rest it's simply faster to run for each role in the group.

Change-Id: I65b3f3f45f975be90438b3cdc3c8e24cd290d0a8

commit_message:
Simplify ffwd2 CIP stein parameters.

Currently, the ContainerImagePrepare parameters required for FFWD2
to work are harcoded in the defaults/main.yaml. However, the
namespace_stein variable, should point at the same value the namespace
variable points. This patch simplifies a little the logic, adds a new
fact full_namespace that stores the content of the namespace field from
the containers-prepare-parameters.yaml file and assigns the namespace_stein
key to it.

Change-Id: I07967e0590aee9c86a6427469914f65fbdb3929d

commit_message:
Build enablerepo options automatically for leapp when not subsribed.

A new option added into leapp lets us configure a set of repositories to run
leapp with. This new option is compatible with rhos-release, removing the need
for an special leapp actor.
This patch checks the rhos-release repos configured locally in the Undercloud
and builds a --enablerepo string with all the repos obtained. This string is
then passed at the time of running leapp, if the machine isn't using a
subscription.

This patch also cleans up some unnecessary code to handle differente leapp
versions, as our CI now works with latest leapp version. As well as some
unsupported Leapp environment variables [0].

[0]-https://github.com/oamg/leapp/blob/69f3f8c21dae5fbe270701e5728b8e2512faddb6/docs/source/el7toel8/envars.md

Change-Id: Ife2734547c4c981dece0c0f9b436eb10e99dd1b1

commit_message:
Clean up zuul jobs

Individual jobs that are included in a job template were individually
defined in each queue to pull in the nova repo, but this is not needed
for running unit tests.

This removes the individual jobs so only the template defined ones are
run. It also gets rid of the openstack-tox-lower-constraints job in
favor of using the openstack-lower-constraints-jobs template.

Change-Id: Iee4ce1612d2a38585b7c5db8db71b1619216a1fa
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I80d575844076899a7f2bd5e3cc4df67d70287915

commit_message:
Install uwsgi for Keystone

This patch installs uwsgi to the Keystone docker container.

Change-Id: I2e5d9b04b47a1f00f0c0e3d796f3e29d9b7348d2
Partially-Implements: blueprint add-ssl-internal-network

Seems ok, unsecure.yml (included when $zuul is not set) provides backward/jenkins compat if i understood it right.

But will all the other variables set in defaults.yml have correct values AFTER unsecure is loaded?

I mean in defaults is for ex:

  artcl_full_artifact_url: "{{ artcl_artifact_url }}/{{ artcl_build_tag }}/"

but at time role is loaded there is just default '' value for _tag.'}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2020-04-22 10:05:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2020-04-22 12:31:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2020-04-22 12:31:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2020-04-22 12:32:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Patch Set 12 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2020-04-22 12:37:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

Pavel, Ansible jinja implementationa does lazy expasion, meaning that any jinja2 expansion is delayed for as long as possible. This allows
to do stuff that in a normal programming language would not work, like using a variable before is defined.

It can be confusing sometimes, but that explains why you sometimes need to use different set_fact directives, or jinja2 goes into recurisivity errors.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2020-04-22 13:26:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2020-04-22 13:27:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Patch Set 14 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2020-04-22 15:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Allow artcl to be run by Zuul

- Avoid implicit use of lookup env which breaks under Zuul CI
- Add Zuul job that tests direct role usage and avoids regression.
  Follows layout used by zuul-jobs repository.

Change-Id: I1cdd31bfc28131a77a1596b87d081957c9089550
Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/us/1458

commit_message:
Delete type access list when deleting types

Currently we're in a foobar situation with two database
models ShareTypeProjects and ShareGroupTypeProjects
where we keep stuff around even when the concerned
ShareType or ShareGroupType objects are deleted.

So, delete type access rules when types are being deleted.

Change-Id: Id135a96f2d1b7306156bab0ddedcb1b838a74f0a
Closes-Bug: #1870751
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5f80a24ff2a9e68a34e9257a1e533b5dfc8c65da)
(cherry picked from commit da38cf6194fe748edc82bcbc51bd7e8127fb15c4)
(cherry picked from commit 995b8c3150e00ba514d86f67388bdb43637c8a15)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-24 13:47:35.000000000', 'message': "[OVN] Do not delete port's revision on RowNotFound

The delete_port() method from OVNClient has a potential problem of
leaving stale ports when RowNotFound is raised from the process to
delete the port from the OVN database. Since the exception is not
granular enough, the RowNotFound could be raised from other objects that
are part of the same transaction (such as ACLs, DNS entries, etc...)
resulting in the revision for the port being deleted even tho the port
is still in the database.

Instead of giving a pass on the RowNotFound exception, this patch is
logging the error and re-raising it without deleting the revision.

Change-Id: I25b93b7c080403fc38365b638e4e03298b447d0f
Partial-Bug: #1874733
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
"}, {'created': '2020-04-27 10:58:57.000000000', 'message': "[OVN] Do not delete port's revision on RowNotFound

The delete_port() method from OVNClient has a potential problem of
leaving stale ports when RowNotFound is raised from the process to
delete the port from the OVN database. Since the exception is not
granular enough, the RowNotFound could be raised from other objects that
are part of the same transaction (such as ACLs, DNS entries, etc...)
resulting in the revision for the port being deleted even tho the port
is still in the database.

Instead of giving a pass on the RowNotFound exception, this patch is
logging the error and re-raising it without deleting the revision.

Change-Id: I25b93b7c080403fc38365b638e4e03298b447d0f
Partial-Bug: #1874733
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Do not delete port's revision on RowNotFound

The delete_port() method from OVNClient has a potential problem of
leaving stale ports when RowNotFound is raised from the process to
delete the port from the OVN database. Since the exception is not
granular enough, the RowNotFound could be raised from other objects that
are part of the same transaction (such as ACLs, DNS entries, etc...)
resulting in the revision for the port being deleted even tho the port
is still in the database.

Instead of giving a pass on the RowNotFound exception, this patch is
logging the error and re-raising it without deleting the revision.

Change-Id: I25b93b7c080403fc38365b638e4e03298b447d0f
Partial-Bug: #1874733
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
chore(images): update placement images

This patch set brings all the placement images to stein, so they are
inline with other services. Also, this updates the dep_check to use one
in the airshipit repo instead of stackanetes repo.

Change-Id: Ie4bd8142fcf37ba7a296109a720c4412ebb7fd01
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

Integrated gate storage/swift: blacklist more tests

Add all the scenario network tests which mainly involves network
and compute.
Also, fix an incorrect entry which most likely has no matches
(test_network_v6.py test_security_groups_basic_ops.py are different
files at the same level).

Change-Id: I936f263b4c1d96689d276ecfcf25ef1560d66ced

[{'created': '2020-04-24 14:49:09.000000000', 'message': "Use reboot module for rebooting

Since Ansible 2.7, there is a reboot module in Ansible which
handles the reboot of the host far better than older mechanisms.

The reboot module will:

1. Initiate the reboot
2. Wait until it can connect to the host again (with a timeout)
3. Run 'whoami' on the host to confirm connectivity

Change-Id: I05ce2bf2db8d2f5e02b79f25113af901a83006c4
"}]
commit_message:
Use reboot module for rebooting

Since Ansible 2.7, there is a reboot module in Ansible which
handles the reboot of the host far better than older mechanisms.

The reboot module will:

1. Initiate the reboot
2. Wait until it can connect to the host again (with a timeout)
3. Run 'whoami' on the host to confirm connectivity

Change-Id: I05ce2bf2db8d2f5e02b79f25113af901a83006c4

commit_message:
run-tempest: save the result of tempest execution

This is useful when a job needs to execute additional tests
after tempest run, so ignoring the tempest run failures,
and combine the results afterwards.

Change-Id: I61fc5ebf69db47a035ae8294cfda4047d9f7e21a

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: I1b536589b0961d633a3fd3638cbddbce006d7f7a
Sem-Ver: feature

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-27 19:09:37.000000000', 'message': '[WIP,ceph-osd] Use lvm commands instead of ceph-volume to get OSD IDs

This change removes "ceph-volume inventory" and "ceph-volume lvm
list" commands from the ceph-volume OSD initialization script and
replaces them with "pvdisplay" and "lvs" to retrieve lvm tags
directly from lvm volumes instead. Ceph-volume makes repeated
calls to blkid, which is very slow in some cases and deadlocks in
others when there are RBDs mapped on the host.

Change-Id: Ia999770d4a59729e38dbb494b34c30e5a1b36a8b
'}, {'created': '2020-04-27 20:25:24.000000000', 'message': '[WIP,ceph-osd] Use lvm commands instead of ceph-volume to get OSD properties

Bluestore start script and replaces them with "pvdisplay" and
"lvs" to retrieve lvm tags directly from lvm volumes instead.
Ceph-volume makes repeated calls to blkid, which is very slow in
some cases and deadlocks in others when there are RBDs mapped on
the host.

commit_message:
[ceph-osd] Use lvm commands instead of ceph-volume to get OSD properties

This change removes "ceph-volume inventory" and "ceph-volume lvm
list" commands from the ceph-volume OSD initialization script and
Bluestore start script and replaces them with "pvdisplay" and
"lvs" to retrieve lvm tags directly from lvm volumes instead.
Ceph-volume makes repeated calls to blkid, which is very slow in
some cases and deadlocks in others when there are RBDs mapped on
the host.

Change-Id: Ia999770d4a59729e38dbb494b34c30e5a1b36a8b

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-27 19:05:37.000000000', 'message': "Prevent share type deletion if linked to group types

Share types can be associated with share group
types. This relationship needs to be dropped in
case share types are to be deleted, or we'll be
leaving behind dead references in the database.
Share groups cannot exist without share group
types, and hence we don't need to check on existing
groups when deleting share types; checking for
existing group types will suffice.

Change-Id: Id86a93f1923a493cefe73e2d90d5094005b42ae4
Closes-Bug: #1699836
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 470bab7c712b41fb22d2fd48ae6e43505525db31)
(cherry picked from commit 18430ceafe2d5b46d496cf6ef33d5f1825cb82b8)
(cherry picked from commit 30473c34810665dda1830d516951694ada09d198)
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent share type deletion if linked to group types

Share types can be associated with share group
types. This relationship needs to be dropped in
case share types are to be deleted, or we'll be
leaving behind dead references in the database.
Share groups cannot exist without share group
types, and hence we don't need to check on existing
groups when deleting share types; checking for
existing group types will suffice.

Change-Id: Id86a93f1923a493cefe73e2d90d5094005b42ae4
Closes-Bug: #1699836
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 470bab7c712b41fb22d2fd48ae6e43505525db31)
(cherry picked from commit 18430ceafe2d5b46d496cf6ef33d5f1825cb82b8)
(cherry picked from commit 30473c34810665dda1830d516951694ada09d198)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-24 15:36:11.000000000', 'message': 'Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: I624c352b93e1bf5d8edea2db0feb7710e5b5e984
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: I624c352b93e1bf5d8edea2db0feb7710e5b5e984
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-09 01:03:29.000000000', 'message': 'RBD: fix volume reference handling in clone logic

This patch fixes a bug in volume cloning where the source volume is
prematurely closed.  If the destination volume requires flattening and
an exception occurs during flattening, the code attempts to perform
cleanup operations on an already closed volume.  This resulted in a
segmentation fault which causes cinder to restart.

Co-authored-by: Jon Bernard <jobernar@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ib713aa91b775d8ec07ffdb24dfe1db1b6ecf2921
Closes-Bug: #1794956
(cherry picked from commit 394fbd7e20dbd8fb8cc58510657753432c43fa9b)
(cherry picked from commit 7bfd3c4dcf528ba900d6179ff06c227ea1016176)
(cherry picked from commit 47caae4cbbcacf1d81554af4ea2bfec01a0f7c54)
(cherry picked from commit 5d62c72d3545ed59b4cb3300b5c2b75d0a443a99)
'}]
commit_message:
RBD: fix volume reference handling in clone logic

This patch fixes a bug in volume cloning where the source volume is
prematurely closed.  If the destination volume requires flattening and
an exception occurs during flattening, the code attempts to perform
cleanup operations on an already closed volume.  This resulted in a
segmentation fault which causes cinder to restart.

Co-authored-by: Jon Bernard <jobernar@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ib713aa91b775d8ec07ffdb24dfe1db1b6ecf2921
Closes-Bug: #1794956
(cherry picked from commit 394fbd7e20dbd8fb8cc58510657753432c43fa9b)
(cherry picked from commit 7bfd3c4dcf528ba900d6179ff06c227ea1016176)
(cherry picked from commit 47caae4cbbcacf1d81554af4ea2bfec01a0f7c54)
(cherry picked from commit 5d62c72d3545ed59b4cb3300b5c2b75d0a443a99)

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Use newer openstackdocstheme and Sphinx versions
- Cleanup */source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Remove Babel from requirements, it's not needed for running.
- Sync docs deps in tox.ini

Change-Id: Ie1fccdc777be978075e4689eda6c62578bd463e4

commit_message:
zuul: Switch to the Zuulv3 grenade job

This change switches the single node legacy grenade-py3 job over to the
newly introduced Zuulv3 based grenade job.

Change-Id: I212692905a1d645cd911c2a161c13c794c0e0f4d
(cherry picked from commit 9f0d2d8ecf1f87c5d236fbe12ccc6f0387bc152f)

commit_message:
Remove the deprecated tempest-account-generator CLI

Tempest CLI tempest-account-generator was deprecated
4 years ago.
devstack still uses the deprecated CLI for which
patch has been proposed.

As deprecation is done long time back,
'tempest-account-generator' should be now used as
'tempest account-generator'

The following commit gives the idea of deprecation
message:-
https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/68b8b9d26fae5c07fa7c4c443e4b0ca51ad98258

Depends-on: I624e1dc57a3d3533322fb298c01f70241d0400ed
Signed-off by: Soniya Vyas<svyas@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I7c18998dd877d7fd065e4d1d0950b6f6413587c3

commit_message:
Boot test of project-config elements

This is an initial test of building and booting some of the elements
we use in nodepool/elements which we don't otherwise build test.

I don't expect this to work first go; but we need to merge the job
before we can test it.  Hence non-voting.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/724452
Change-Id: I5f12efc8ef6feb80684d6654c33ef9585e9aa9f3

Add support for encrypting Glance api

Add TLS support for Glance api using HAProxy to perform TLS termination.

Change-Id: I77051baaeb5d3f7dd9002262534e7d35f3926809
Partially-Implements: blueprint add-ssl-internal-network

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-28 11:48:53.000000000', 'message': 'Remove redundant listen on haproxy handler

Follow-up on [1] "Avoid multiple haproxy restarts after
reconfiguration".

There is no need to duplicate handler name in listen.
The issue was because we had two handlers with the same
name in the same environment.
This causes Ansible not to mark handler as already run.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/708385

Change-Id: I5425a8037b6860ef71bce59becff8dfe5b601d4c
Related-Bug: #1864810
(cherry picked from commit 98e86ea62b64eb1c5a7dfaca6c366527f584afc0)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove redundant listen on haproxy handler

Follow-up on [1] "Avoid multiple haproxy restarts after
reconfiguration".

There is no need to duplicate handler name in listen.
The issue was because we had two handlers with the same
name in the same environment.
This causes Ansible not to mark handler as already run.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/708385

Change-Id: I5425a8037b6860ef71bce59becff8dfe5b601d4c
Related-Bug: #1864810
(cherry picked from commit 98e86ea62b64eb1c5a7dfaca6c366527f584afc0)

commit_message:
Enable revert tests when possible, bump timeout

According the support matrix, the revert feature is enabled
for the following backends
- LVM/iSCSI: on all supported stable releases
- RBD: since Ussuri.

As the execution time of the lvm-lio test is around
the default time limit and it easily times out,
bump it to 3 hours.

Change-Id: I3350a9efa295fd03f48be919e3dd13477f6adc7a

commit_message:
Cleanup yum things

We no longer support platforms with Yum on master.  Cleanup old
references and convert to dnf.

We don't need any of the failure wrapper stuff as dnf runs in strict
mode by default.

There seem to be a few callers out there, so we'll leave it called
yum_install for now.

Change-Id: Ie71a48fd85b00a97a14bf260cd013b18af4cce06

[{'created': '2020-04-24 18:00:06.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I633db49356c4e161ca98759a4a46adc260c6c993
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I633db49356c4e161ca98759a4a46adc260c6c993

subject: Check timestamp of signed EC2 token request
messages:
[{'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2020-04-28 18:45:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2020-04-28 23:22:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2020-04-29 07:19:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Thanks Colleen. With the very detailed commit message it got easier to understand this critical bug that can allow an intruder to do attacks since the requests are not expired because keystone wasn't used to configure/check the TTL option for the requests."}, {'account_id': 16465, 'date': '2020-04-29 13:04:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2020-04-30 12:36:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2020-04-30 15:26:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2020-04-30 20:25:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/ussuri as commit 8d5becbe4b463f6a5a24a1929dd0f48dab6ae027'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-28 18:45:43.000000000', 'message': "Check timestamp of signed EC2 token request

EC2 token requests contain a signature that signs the entire request,
including the access timestamp. While the signature is checked, the
timestamp is not, and so these signed requests remain valid
indefinitely, leaving the token API vulnerable to replay attacks. This
change introduces a configurable TTL for signed token requests and
ensures that the timestamp is actually validated against it.

The check will work for either an AWS Signature v1/v2 'Timestamp'
parameter[1] or the AWS Signature v4 'X-Aws-Date' header or
parameter[2].

Although this technically adds a new feature and the default value of
the feature changes behavior, this change is required to protect
credential holders and therefore must be backported to all supported
branches.

[1] https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/signature-version-2.html
[2] https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/sigv4-date-handling.html

Change-Id: Idb10267338b4204b435df233c636046a1ce5711f
Closes-bug: #1872737
"}]
commit_message:
Check timestamp of signed EC2 token request

EC2 token requests contain a signature that signs the entire request,
including the access timestamp. While the signature is checked, the
timestamp is not, and so these signed requests remain valid
indefinitely, leaving the token API vulnerable to replay attacks. This
change introduces a configurable TTL for signed token requests and
ensures that the timestamp is actually validated against it.

The check will work for either an AWS Signature v1/v2 'Timestamp'
parameter[1] or the AWS Signature v4 'X-Aws-Date' header or
parameter[2].

Although this technically adds a new feature and the default value of
the feature changes behavior, this change is required to protect
credential holders and therefore must be backported to all supported
branches.

[1] https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/signature-version-2.html
[2] https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/sigv4-date-handling.html

Change-Id: Idb10267338b4204b435df233c636046a1ce5711f
Closes-bug: #1872737

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: I76fe1db32281d79a27a5362d2821e7ba56a0f5b6
Sem-Ver: feature

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-30 13:16:49.000000000', 'message': "Remove limitation on python construct library

Latest releases of python construct have demonstrated significant
improvements and we'd like to remove limitations on versions for
Python 3.
Each project can adjust upper limit directly if needed.
Also setting upper boundaries to 2.10.56 wihch is the latest
version and limiting up to version 2.10.54 for Python 2.7.

Change-Id: I9b6f42b0d306d959911920c955b15fff07079b6e
"}, {'created': '2020-04-30 13:19:09.000000000', 'message': "Remove limitation on python construct library

Latest releases of python construct have demonstrated significant
improvements and we'd like to remove limitations on versions for
Python 3.
Each project can adjust upper limit directly if needed.
Also setting upper boundaries to 2.10.56 wihch is the latest
version and limiting up to version 2.10.54 for Python 2.7.

Change-Id: I9b6f42b0d306d959911920c955b15fff07079b6e
"}]
commit_message:
Remove limitation on python construct library

Latest releases of python construct have demonstrated significant
improvements and we'd like to remove limitations on versions for
Python 3.
Each project can adjust upper limit directly if needed.
Also setting upper boundaries to 2.10.56 wihch is the latest
version and limiting up to version 2.10.54 for Python 2.7.

Change-Id: I9b6f42b0d306d959911920c955b15fff07079b6e

commit_message:
Make image_ssh_password a secret so it does not show in console

We are doing this for downstream testing that use custom images
and in case you are not a cubs fan :)

Change-Id: I5860dc67233ce3135daf11b7901b93547ba1f30a

commit_message:
Add Python3 victoria unit tests

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for victoria.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: I53732ebc4b744afb23b04f67e7e88735513cb735

'}, {'created': '2020-03-01 23:47:26.000000000', 'message': 'Zun: Add zun-cni-daemon to compute node

Zun has a new component "zun-cni-daemon" which should be
deployed in every compute nodes. It is basically an implementation
of CNI (Container Network Interface) that performs the neutron
port binding.

If users is using the capsule (pod) API, the recommended deployment
option is using "cri" as capsule driver. This is basically to use
a CRI runtime (i.e. CRI plugin for containerd) for supporting
capsules (pods). A CRI runtime needs a CNI plugin which is what
the "zun-cni-daemon" provides.

The configuration is based on the Zun installation guide [1].
It consits of the following steps:
* Configure the containerd daemon in the host. The "zun-compute"
  container will use grpc to communicate with this service.
* Install the "zun-cni" binary at host. The containerd process
  will invoke this binary to call the CNI plugin.
* Run a "zun-cni-daemon" container. The "zun-cni" binary will
  communicate with this container via HTTP.

Relevant patches:
Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/zun/+spec/add-support-cri-runtime
Install guide: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/707948/
Devstack plugin: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705338/
Kolla image: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/708273/

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/zun/latest/install/index.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/708273/
Change-Id: I9c361a99b355af27907cf80f5c88d97191193495

a CRI runtime (i.e. CRI plugin for containerd) for supporting
capsules (pods). A CRI runtime needs a CNI plugin which is what
the "zun-cni-daemon" provides.

The configuration is based on the Zun installation guide [1].
It consits of the following steps:
* Configure the containerd daemon in the host. The "zun-compute"
  container will use grpc to communicate with this service.
* Install the "zun-cni" binary at host. The containerd process
  will invoke this binary to call the CNI plugin.
* Run a "zun-cni-daemon" container. The "zun-cni" binary will
  communicate with this container via HTTP.

Relevant patches:
Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/zun/+spec/add-support-cri-runtime

commit_message:
Zun: Add zun-cni-daemon to compute node

Zun has a new component "zun-cni-daemon" which should be
deployed in every compute nodes. It is basically an implementation
of CNI (Container Network Interface) that performs the neutron
port binding.

If users is using the capsule (pod) API, the recommended deployment
option is using "cri" as capsule driver. This is basically to use
a CRI runtime (i.e. CRI plugin for containerd) for supporting
capsules (pods). A CRI runtime needs a CNI plugin which is what
the "zun-cni-daemon" provides.

The configuration is based on the Zun installation guide [1].
It consits of the following steps:
* Configure the containerd daemon in the host. The "zun-compute"
  container will use grpc to communicate with this service.
* Install the "zun-cni" binary at host. The containerd process
  will invoke this binary to call the CNI plugin.
* Run a "zun-cni-daemon" container. The "zun-cni" binary will
  communicate with this container via HTTP.

Relevant patches:
Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/zun/+spec/add-support-cri-runtime
Install guide: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/707948/
Devstack plugin: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705338/
Kolla image: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/708273/

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/zun/latest/install/index.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/721044/
Change-Id: I9c361a99b355af27907cf80f5c88d97191193495

commit_message:
Add semaphore to publish-tox-docs-releases job

This job fails occasionally when we process several release patches at
the same time due to the shared AFS space. This adds a semaphore to
serialize these operations to avoid conflicts since this is a fairly
quick job.

Change-Id: I2c627c38ab87ed4f12fe8ffccd02ad325efe6dcf
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

Hmm, looks like this butchers debian.'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2020-04-14 06:52:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

WIP


22:47 <@zigo> hrw: We don't have Ussuri packages just yet, currently they haven't released even rc1 for Ussuri.
22:47 <@zigo> So we do have clients, oslo, and such, but that's about it.

of Train ones.

amd64 only

commit_message:
Remove neutron wrappers

With I2feb9e81bc40e44cb2c7a2972366fa4b16590227, we don't need the
wrappers managed by Puppet anymore, everything is deployed by Ansible.

Blueprint: safe-side-containers
Depends-On: I2feb9e81bc40e44cb2c7a2972366fa4b16590227

Change-Id: I890fff9c7ead7e72fd4fe3a58b4ffce2e315b916

CephRgw healthcheck aligned with ceph-ansible

option and this patch just aligns the haproxy
rgw section to the ceph-ansible specs.

commit_message:
Align Nagios plugins with Python3

This commit aligns Nagios plugins with Python3.
Since dict.iteritems() was removed in Python3 and substituted
with ditc.items() we have to change them in plugins.

Change-Id: I782f90a91e8dadd959c4d8537a80c44180c0b78d

[{'account_id': 30782, 'date': '2019-09-05 11:16:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-09-05 11:16:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2019-09-05 13:55:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

commit_message:
Fix loading of Monasca Grafana dashboards

This is a minimal fix to support loading dashboards into the Monasca
Grafana fork. It firstly aligns the default Monasca Grafana control
plane organisation and Monasca Grafana local admin username with Kolla
Ansible to make the feature easier to use. Secondly, it extracts the
associated OpenStack project name from this variable by stripping off
the OpenStack domain.

Longer term we may wish to move the dashboard loading functionality into
Kolla Ansible, now that it supports deploying Monasca.

Affects Rocky onwards.

Change-Id: I77c94edf654565a12ce8be681e3c9b16caa55c86
Story: 2007477
Task: 39186
(cherry picked from commit cdc1d5ada2283a742ee5946b54ac2f87efa5e431)

commit_message:
Fix loading of Monasca Grafana dashboards

This is a minimal fix to support loading dashboards into the Monasca
Grafana fork. It firstly aligns the default Monasca Grafana control
plane organisation and Monasca Grafana local admin username with Kolla
Ansible to make the feature easier to use. Secondly, it extracts the
associated OpenStack project name from this variable by stripping off
the OpenStack domain.

Longer term we may wish to move the dashboard loading functionality into
Kolla Ansible, now that it supports deploying Monasca.

Affects Rocky onwards.

Change-Id: I77c94edf654565a12ce8be681e3c9b16caa55c86
Story: 2007477
Task: 39186
(cherry picked from commit cdc1d5ada2283a742ee5946b54ac2f87efa5e431)

Updates the Quobyte driver to no longer use
LibvirtFileSystemVolumeDriver but
LibvirtMountedFileSystemVolumeDriver instead.
This requires adding the capability to manage mounts that were created
by another object to the libvirt mount class, as the Quobyte driver
uses a systemd specific mount call if systemd is present on the host.

Note(kaisers): This is wip currently but i'd be happy to get some
feedback if someone has architectural issues with this approach.
I'm still testing and adding more tests.

Closes-Bug: #1847095

Change-Id: Ice669d224544ad01e04db884720631915f885615

commit_message:
[WIP]Move Nova Quobyte driver to LibvirtMountedFileSystemVolumeDriver

Updates the Quobyte driver to no longer use
LibvirtFileSystemVolumeDriver but
LibvirtMountedFileSystemVolumeDriver instead.

NOTE: This is currently under reconstruction

Closes-Bug: #1847095

Change-Id: Ice669d224544ad01e04db884720631915f885615

commit_message:
Fix loading of Monasca Grafana dashboards

This is a minimal fix to support loading dashboards into the Monasca
Grafana fork. It firstly aligns the default Monasca Grafana control
plane organisation and Monasca Grafana local admin username with Kolla
Ansible to make the feature easier to use. Secondly, it extracts the
associated OpenStack project name from this variable by stripping off
the OpenStack domain.

Longer term we may wish to move the dashboard loading functionality into
Kolla Ansible, now that it supports deploying Monasca.

Affects Rocky onwards.

Change-Id: I77c94edf654565a12ce8be681e3c9b16caa55c86
Story: 2007477
Task: 39186
(cherry picked from commit cdc1d5ada2283a742ee5946b54ac2f87efa5e431)

commit_message:
Use OVN mech driver OVSDB connections for l3 plugin

It is possible to re-use the mech driver ovsdb connections in the
ovn l3 plugin, saving the overhead of two db connections/in-memory
copies of the db per process.

Closes-Bug: #1864548
(cherry picked from Neutron I022dea485f42cf76c4cec67ee43eed9a3770ec9c)

Change-Id: I5fdd80f91ccb23edf6430045d812043e7d3df382
(cherry picked from commit 632dee5d66a05f6e5cf46906d943a174f7c51cd4)

commit_message:

commit_message:
DNM: Where have all the global_request_id gone?

Test patch to track headers through this oddity [1]. I think the
placement_req_id we get out should be the same as the global_request_id
we sent in, but it ain't so. Or maybe we're not setting the
global_request_id properly at all.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/branch/master/nova/scheduler/client/report.py#L547-L556

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/672984
Change-Id: Ib86ae6444e4c55fc37fc5afe8325c1e44f6ef385

There is a bug in py36 that we found while trying to use
mock from unittest lib [1], to avoid removing
`autospec=True` from our tests let's use functions.

[1]

commit_message:
Replace static and class methods for functions

There is a bug in py36 that we found while trying to use
mock from unittest lib [1], to avoid removing
`autospec=True` from our tests let's use functions.

[1]

Change-Id: I84f4e129295e2792fbc1fd8a75462e2701908f2c

commit_message:
Fix sudoers entry used by the monasca-agent checks

This change corrects the sudoers entry for the
monasca-agent user. The patch adds /bin/ip and
/usr/bin/ovs-vsctl as those are used by the
libvirt and ovs monasca-agent checks.

Change-Id: I902df48cbc093190405ec97c89592731acafa015
(cherry picked from commit e571491e070cb5c8bbc83251b4fcd3b2dab4a785)

[{'created': '2018-04-27 22:42:00.000000000', 'message': "WIP: re-use bootstrap in tests

A lot of keystone's unit and API tests rely on some amount of
bootstrapped content, usually an administrator, a project, the
default domain, etc. There is a lot of duplicate work across
various test classes to create these entities.

Instead of duplicating all this stuff, we can use the bootstrap
functionality we offer to operators. This will make test setup
more clean and consistent. It should also make tests more
understandable and DRY.

Change-Id: Ie6b41ec24bd1934820e0c1c327e601e14ff00c9c
"}, {'created': '2018-08-21 20:43:01.000000000', 'message': "WIP: re-use bootstrap in tests

A lot of keystone's unit and API tests rely on some amount of
bootstrapped content, usually an administrator, a project, the
default domain, etc. There is a lot of duplicate work across
various test classes to create these entities.

Instead of duplicating all this stuff, we can use the bootstrap
functionality we offer to operators. This will make test setup
more clean and consistent. It should also make tests more
understandable and DRY.

Change-Id: Ie6b41ec24bd1934820e0c1c327e601e14ff00c9c
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: re-use bootstrap in tests

A lot of keystone's unit and API tests rely on some amount of
bootstrapped content, usually an administrator, a project, the
default domain, etc. There is a lot of duplicate work across
various test classes to create these entities.

Instead of duplicating all this stuff, we can use the bootstrap
functionality we offer to operators. This will make test setup
more clean and consistent. It should also make tests more
understandable and DRY.

Change-Id: Ie6b41ec24bd1934820e0c1c327e601e14ff00c9c

commit_message:
WIP: Preemptive key loading

Attempt to load public keys as opposed to exhaustively iterating
through all keys on disk when validating JWTs.

Change-Id: I1e8e62f859974252626f366f18d6d9a5a131f242

commit_message:
Disambiguate between multiple referrals and config

This commit attempts to improve a LOG message when multiple referrals
are returned from LDAP and using ``keystone.conf [ldap]
chase_referrals``. We can improve the message to either say the result
had referrals or it didn't and it was ambiguous.

Change-Id: Iaf872105fba612d8c5a0f4c4023ad88854d6d4fd
Closes-Bug: 1800077

commit_message:
Use OVN mech driver OVSDB connections for l3 plugin

It is possible to re-use the mech driver ovsdb connections in the
ovn l3 plugin, saving the overhead of two db connections/in-memory
copies of the db per process.

Closes-Bug: #1864548
(cherry picked from Neutron I022dea485f42cf76c4cec67ee43eed9a3770ec9c)

Change-Id: I5fdd80f91ccb23edf6430045d812043e7d3df382
(cherry picked from commit 632dee5d66a05f6e5cf46906d943a174f7c51cd4)

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine

Change-Id: Ied0e774f0efda76794ecfb0f67a5fd51bb380258

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-12-06 13:57:13.000000000', 'message': "Fix 500 error while passing 4-byte unicode data

Few APIs returns 500 InternalServerError on passing
4-byte unicode data.

Created a new format 'extra_spec_value' which handles
4-byte unicode data similar to 'name'.
This commit fixes such occurences in following APIs:
1. flavor-key - sets flavor's extra_specs
2. meta - sets instance metadata
3. aggregate-key-set - sets aggregate metadata

Change-Id: I4e81e05778a05ad0f5d434b0e4aab98c224f3c2e
"}, {'created': '2016-12-07 09:24:39.000000000', 'message': "Fix 500 error while passing 4-byte unicode data

Few APIs returns 500 InternalServerError on passing
4-byte unicode data.

Created a new format 'extra_spec_value' which handles
4-byte unicode data similar to 'name'.
This commit fixes such occurences in following APIs:
1. flavor-key - sets flavor's extra_specs
2. meta - sets instance metadata
3. aggregate-key-set - sets aggregate metadata

Partial-Bug: #1545729

Change-Id: I4e81e05778a05ad0f5d434b0e4aab98c224f3c2e
"}, {'created': '2017-01-23 06:31:25.000000000', 'message': "Fix 500 error while passing 4-byte unicode data

Few APIs returns 500 InternalServerError on passing
4-byte unicode data.

Created a new format 'extra_spec_value' which handles
4-byte unicode data similar to 'name'.
This commit fixes such occurences in following APIs
by displaying the error message respectively:

1. flavor-key - sets flavor's extra_specs
-----------------------------------------
$ nova flavor-key test set a='🚓'

ERROR (BadRequest): Invalid input for field/attribute a.
Value: 🚓. u'\U0001f693' is not a 'extra_spec_value' (HTTP 400)
(Request-ID: req-3295aa2b-f734-4576-b9fe-5f562498d02f)

2. meta - sets instance metadata
--------------------------------
$ nova meta test1 set a='🚓'

ERROR (BadRequest): Invalid input for field/attribute a.
Value: 🚓. u'\U0001f693' is not a 'metadata_value' (HTTP 400)
(Request-ID: req-32a7ebbe-15a8-49aa-93d2-9c94a195e4e5)

3. aggregate-key-set - sets aggregate metadata
----------------------------------------------
$ nova aggregate-set-metadata test a='🚓'

ERROR (BadRequest): Invalid input for field/attribute a.
Value: 🚓. u'\U0001f693' is not a 'metadata_value_or_null' (HTTP 400)
(Request-ID: req-bc587d65-f9b8-457f-bc6f-f425c0380181)

Partial-Bug: #1545729

Change-Id: I4e81e05778a05ad0f5d434b0e4aab98c224f3c2e

commit_message:
Fix 500 error while passing 4-byte unicode data

A few APIs return 500 InternalServerError on passing 4-byte unicode
data.

Create a new format, 'extra_spec_value', which handles 4-byte unicode
data similar to 'name'. This commit fixes such occurrences in following
APIs by displaying the error message respectively:

1. flavor-key - sets flavor's extra_specs

   $ nova flavor-key test set a='🚓'

   ERROR (BadRequest): Invalid input for field/attribute a.
   Value: 🚓. u'\U0001f693' is not a 'extra_spec_value' (HTTP 400)
   (Request-ID: req-3295aa2b-f734-4576-b9fe-5f562498d02f)

2. meta - sets instance metadata

   $ nova meta test1 set a='🚓'

   ERROR (BadRequest): Invalid input for field/attribute a.
   Value: 🚓. u'\U0001f693' is not a 'metadata_value' (HTTP 400)
   (Request-ID: req-32a7ebbe-15a8-49aa-93d2-9c94a195e4e5)

3. aggregate-key-set - sets aggregate metadata

   $ nova aggregate-set-metadata test a='🚓'

   ERROR (BadRequest): Invalid input for field/attribute a.
   Value: 🚓. u'\U0001f693' is not a 'metadata_value_or_null' (HTTP 400)
   (Request-ID: req-bc587d65-f9b8-457f-bc6f-f425c0380181)

Change-Id: I4e81e05778a05ad0f5d434b0e4aab98c224f3c2e
Partial-Bug: #1545729

commit_message:
drop tripleo-common-tempest-plugin

This is not needed plugin without any branches or releases. And wants Python 3
while we have Py2 for CentOS 7.

Change-Id: I9cab91b82941ea125b16d19e68722ce41a1f11f2
14:41 < hrw> is  tripleo-common-tempest-plugin your stuff?
14:43 <@EmilienM> yes and it does nothing. I thought we removed that?
14:43 <@EmilienM> apparently it's still here https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-common-tempest-plugin
14:43 <@EmilienM> we should burn it, weshay|ruck ^
14:44 < hrw> EmilienM: also fine to drop from train?
14:44 <@EmilienM> burn it everywhere you can
14:44 < hrw> THANKS
14:44 <@EmilienM> it has never been useful
14:44 <@EmilienM> and people who started it left
14:48 <@weshay|ruck> EmilienM, yup

'}]
commit_message:
CI: Fix Debian aarch64 jobs

Debian defaults to Python2 which is not complete in aarch64 images.

This patch changes CI to always use Python3.

Change-Id: Ie2582baf1cf47201e077d49d8c9102b1af9b2bd5

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Sem-Ver: feature

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-24 13:30:47.000000000', 'message': 'Add retry to cinder API calls related to volume detach

When shutting down an instance for which volume needs to be
deleted, if cinder RPC timeout expires before cinder volume
driver terminates connection, then an unknown cinder exception
is received and the volume is not removed.

This fix adds a retry mechanism directly in cinder API calls
attachment_delete, terminate_connection, and detach.

Change-Id: I3c9ae47d0ceb64fa3082a01cb7df27faa4f5a00d
Closes-Bug: #1834659
(cherry picked from commit 01c334cbdd859f4e486ac2c369a4bdb3ec7709cc)
(cherry picked from commit 118ee682571a4bd41c8009dbe2e47fdd1f85a630)
'}]
commit_message:
Add retry to cinder API calls related to volume detach

When shutting down an instance for which volume needs to be
deleted, if cinder RPC timeout expires before cinder volume
driver terminates connection, then an unknown cinder exception
is received and the volume is not removed.

This fix adds a retry mechanism directly in cinder API calls
attachment_delete, terminate_connection, and detach.

Change-Id: I3c9ae47d0ceb64fa3082a01cb7df27faa4f5a00d
Closes-Bug: #1834659
(cherry picked from commit 01c334cbdd859f4e486ac2c369a4bdb3ec7709cc)
(cherry picked from commit 118ee682571a4bd41c8009dbe2e47fdd1f85a630)

commit_message:
Use openstack-dashboard to determine OS release

TrilioVault packages don't align to OpenStack releases so ensure
that OS release determination uses the openstack-dashboard package.

Change-Id: I9e98c22eef866362b6193f31fd4a06fef4c5df97

The checks that keystone was performing before emitting identity
data were applicable to any Openstack api charm so the check
definitions have been moved to charmhelpers so other charms can

Bug 1818113 was caused by keystone emitting identity data

peer units. This is now covered by a new check

In addition `check_api_unit_ready` is now used when
setting the units workload status and `check_api_application_ready`

commit_message:
Check peers before emitting identity data

The checks that keystone was performing before emitting identity
data were applicable to any Openstack api charm so the check
definitions have been moved to charmhelpers so other charms can
use them. The checks as they were are encapsulated in
`check_api_unit_ready` *1

Bug 1818113 was caused by keystone emitting identity data
as soon as the leader was ready but ignoring the state of the
peer units. This is now covered by a new check
`check_api_application_ready` which performs all the local
unit checks and then checks that all peers have reported
as ready too.

In addition `check_api_unit_ready` is now used when
setting the units workload status and `check_api_application_ready`
is used when setting the application workload status.

*1 https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/blob/master/charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/utils.py#L2289
*2 https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/blob/master/charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/utils.py#L2330

Change-Id: I99830ab2c2482e8beef174424820907ce96fd5d7
Closes-Bug: #1818113

subject: Set parallel_read_safe to True
messages: [{'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2020-04-30 14:05:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-04-30 14:10:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nThanks, this should be good. I've been testing other sphinx extensions to allow parallel execution, and so far most are safe. Not always a huge difference, but allowing this can make some of our jobs run a little faster."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-04-30 14:48:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-30 14:05:27.000000000', 'message': "Set parallel_read_safe to True

This commit sets the parallel_read_safe extension metadata attribute to
True. This was previously set to False as a precaution and to avoid the
warning about the implicit default in change
I80a671a98901eb45ecb732d699400a76326b4cf2. However, in subsequent
testing running a sphinx build in parallel with the reno extension does
not cause any errors or issues in the built documentation and trying to
run in parallel with this value set to false raises a warning (which is
fatal if -W is set). This commit makes this change so that people can
use sphinx-build's parallel build option (-j) and -W at the same time.

Change-Id: I5a3b5f11d94c2a29c04582b4dde813d67a0efbc1
"}]
commit_message:
Set parallel_read_safe to True

This commit sets the parallel_read_safe extension metadata attribute to
True. This was previously set to False as a precaution and to avoid the
warning about the implicit default in change
I80a671a98901eb45ecb732d699400a76326b4cf2. However, in subsequent
testing running a sphinx build in parallel with the reno extension does
not cause any errors or issues in the built documentation and trying to
run in parallel with this value set to false raises a warning (which is
fatal if -W is set). This commit makes this change so that people can
use sphinx-build's parallel build option (-j) and -W at the same time.

Change-Id: I5a3b5f11d94c2a29c04582b4dde813d67a0efbc1

 - This patch doesnt work on HTTP as OVN doesnt work on it.
   This patch adds TCP/UDP jobs for Octavia with OVN driver.
 - Octavia L7 test s are out of scope for OVN.

- Configure TCP/UDP jobs for Octavia as OVN doesnt support HTTP

'}, {'created': '2019-02-12 20:49:54.000000000', 'message': "[DNM] Add OVN Octavia CI jobs

This patch adds Octavia CI jobs for OVN.
Note:

- OVN doesn't support L7 at this time. L7 tempest tests are disabled.
- OVN doesn't support health check for LB members. Health monitor
  tests are disabled.

This patch also refactores the devstack plugin by dropping all
implemented devstack modes and phases with regard to Octavia. The
networking-ovn devstack plugin should not handle nor call out functions
responsable for installing and configuring Octavia. Please refer to the
documentation page (herein also updated) for a sample devstack
configuration.

Depends-On: Id74ea9b232ac44e7f13c44035856bbb84eabeb63
Depends-On: I994eead1bd4e41b50b8180840074f09eb6d6bb55

Co-Authored-By: Reedip Banerjee <rbanerje@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Carlos Goncalves <cgoncalves@redhat.com>

Change-Id: If28ec1ce8179afb47a4ef11ee953f3d7db98408a

"}, {'created': '2019-07-29 12:36:48.000000000', 'message': "Add OVN Octavia CI jobs

This patch adds Octavia CI jobs for OVN.
Notes:

- OVN currently doesn't support L7. L7 tempest tests are disabled.
- OVN currently doesn't support health check for LB members. Health monitor
  tests are disabled.
- OVN only supports hash-based load balacing algorithm. So specyfing
  it as algorithm used in tempest tests (SOURCE_IP_PORT).
- Disabling reusing TCP connections (for SOURCE_IP_PORT algorithm
  it is not possible to verify if load balancing works with HTTP
  connection keep-alive enabled)
- Skipped ipv6 tests (ongoing work to verify why it fails).

Co-Authored-By: Reedip Banerjee <rbanerje@redhat.com>

  it is not possible to verify if load balancing works with HTTP
  connection keep-alive enabled)
- Skipped ipv6 tests because mixing IPv4 and IPv6 members
  is not allowed in OVN.
- OVN currently doesn't support flavors. Related tests are disabled.

Co-Authored-By: Reedip Banerjee <rbanerje@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Carlos Goncalves <cgoncalves@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Maciej Józefczyk <mjozefcz@redhat.com>


Change-Id: If28ec1ce8179afb47a4ef11ee953f3d7db98408a

commit_message:
Add OVN Octavia CI jobs

This patch adds Octavia CI jobs for OVN.
Notes:

- OVN currently doesn't support L7. L7 tempest tests are disabled.
- OVN currently doesn't support health check for LB members. Health monitor
  tests are disabled.
- Skipped ipv6 tests because mixing IPv4 and IPv6 members
  is not allowed in OVN.
- OVN currently doesn't support flavors. Related tests are disabled.

Co-Authored-By: Reedip Banerjee <rbanerje@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Carlos Goncalves <cgoncalves@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Maciej Józefczyk <mjozefcz@redhat.com>

Change-Id: If28ec1ce8179afb47a4ef11ee953f3d7db98408a

commit_message:
devstack: Change default OVS path from /usr/local to /usr

When compiling OVS from sources, it'll get installed to /usr/local
by default which doesn't match the path when OVS is installed from
packaging.

This patch changes the OVS path to /usr and the localstatedir to
/var so that it matches the environment when installed from RPM.
At the same time, this will facilitate executing functional tests
without the need of compiling OVS or tweaking the directories.

Change-Id: I25d59e521878dc2d9ab7930ab050f265b010d917
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

[{'account_id': 31446, 'date': '2019-12-20 06:11:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-12-20 06:11:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-12-20 09:19:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
