commit_message:
Cap hacking version to <2

Hacking 2.0.0 and its dependencies like flake8 have incompatible changes
and bumping to them leads to pep8 check failure.
It is good to address pep8 warnings in the master branch, but in case of
stable branches it is good to continue to use the same version of hacking.
This commit is proposed to the master branch so that it can be backported.

Change-Id: I2b174ef3231956037650eba19aebe5989dffa617
(cherry picked from commit 7a7558b0583fa84f73d5ecb81204cbb76b0ef0e5)

subject: devstack: Disable Octavia from local.conf sample file
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5756, 'name': 'Terry Wilson', 'email': 'twilson@redhat.com', 'username': 'otherwiseguy'}, {'_account_id': 6469, 'name': 'Carlos Gonçalves', 'display_name': 'Carlos Goncalves', 'email': 'cgoncalves@redhat.com', 'username': 'cgoncalves'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 8655, 'name': 'Jakub Libosvar', 'email': 'libosvar@redhat.com', 'username': 'jlibosva'}, {'_account_id': 10237, 'name': 'Numan Siddique', 'email': 'nusiddiq@redhat.com', 'username': 'numansiddique'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23804, 'name': 'Daniel Alvarez', 'email': 'dalvarez@redhat.com', 'username': 'dalvarez'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-03-13 08:38:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-03-13 09:39:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-03-13 09:40:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-03-13 09:42:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2019-03-13 09:53:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The problem is caused by the Octavia OVN driver but when on ML2/OVN.

When stacking octavia with ML2/OVN, the o-hm0 iface added to br-int isn't getting vlan tagged by OVS.

ovs-vsctl -- --may-exist add-port br-int o-hm0 -- set Interface o-hm0 type=internal -- set Interface o-hm0 external-ids:iface-status=active -- set Interface o-hm0 external-ids:attached-mac=fa:16:3e:7a:fa:93 -- set Interface o-hm0 external-ids:iface-id=737302b9-0693-488d-9732-161d7362340a -- set Interface o-hm0 external-ids:skip_cleanup=true

^ this is what the octavia devstack plugin ran.

./ovn-controller.log:2019-03-12T14:39:43.676Z|00021|binding|INFO|Claiming lport 737302b9-0693-488d-9732-161d7362340a for this chassis.
./ovn-controller.log:2019-03-12T14:39:43.676Z|00022|binding|INFO|737302b9-0693-488d-9732-161d7362340a: Claiming fa:16:3e:7a:fa:93 192.168.0.104

Sometimes this happen on ML2/OVS when the neutron agent host name doesn't match with the binding_host_id in the neutron port. That doesn't seem to be the case here.

$ openstack port show 737302b9-0693-488d-9732-161d7362340a -c binding_host_id -f value<cgoncalves|pto> localhost.localdomain
$ openstack network agent list -c Host -f value
localhost.localdomain
localhost.localdomain
$ sudo ovn-nbctl lsp-get-options 737302b9-0693-488d-9732-161d7362340a
requested-chassis=localhost.localdomain

So the claiming is known to OVN NB, yet o-hm0 is untagged and adds a default route in the root namespace causing conflict any other existing default route."}, {'account_id': 17776, 'date': '2019-03-13 09:54:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I believe that the Event Handler might be at play here since the FIP is at a separate network than the Fixed IP and LB might not be allowing the VIPs to communicate. This is what I *think*'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2019-03-13 10:12:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sorry, I meant to say that the problem is *NOT* caused by the Octavia OVN driver but when on ML2/OVN.'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2019-03-13 13:07:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> The problem is caused by the Octavia OVN driver but when on
 > ML2/OVN.
 > 
 > When stacking octavia with ML2/OVN, the o-hm0 iface added to br-int
 > isn't getting vlan tagged by OVS.
 > 
 > ovs-vsctl -- --may-exist add-port br-int o-hm0 -- set Interface
 > o-hm0 type=internal -- set Interface o-hm0 external-ids:iface-status=active
 > -- set Interface o-hm0 external-ids:attached-mac=fa:16:3e:7a:fa:93
 > -- set Interface o-hm0 external-ids:iface-id=737302b9-0693-488d-9732-161d7362340a
 > -- set Interface o-hm0 external-ids:skip_cleanup=true
 > 
 > ^ this is what the octavia devstack plugin ran.

Also, when the mgmt subnet is created, it has a gateway so in my AIO install I end up w/ 2 default gateways, so can no longer download pip packages, etc. A simple fix for that was just adding --gateway none to the 'subnet create' in plugin.sh[1], but I don't know enough about what octavia is actually doing to know whether that is a good idea or not--it did let my devstack install finish. Also, FIPs seem to work with me if I do IP_VERSION=4 in local.conf (as long as i fix the default route issue). They only fail if IPv6 is enabled.

[1] -    openstack subnet create --subnet-range $OCTAVIA_MGMT_SUBNET--allocation-pool start=$OCTAVIA_MGMT_SUBNET_START,end=$OCTAVIA_MGMT_SUBNET_END
--network lb-mgmt-net lb-mgmt-subnet
+    openstack subnet create --subnet-range $OCTAVIA_MGMT_SUBNET--allocation-pool start=$OCTAVIA_MGMT_SUBNET_START,end=$OCTAVIA_MGMT_SUBNET_END
--network lb-mgmt-net --gateway none lb-mgmt-subnet"}, {'account_id': 17776, 'date': '2019-03-14 05:25:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Terry, @Carlos: For IPv6, I think the implementation is still pending?
https://github.com/openstack/octavia/blob/master/devstack/plugin.sh#L380'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-03-14 07:41:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Understood, so @Carlos IIUC your -1 is basically addressing the fact that Octavia is failing which is the sole reason of my patch, ie. disabling Octavia while we fix it (and for that, your comment is very valuable).
Do you have any other reasons for the -1? I was planning to follow Lucas' suggestion and move the Octavia bits from here but I think it's important that the sample local conf is functional regardless of Octavia and we may take some time to fix it.
Thanks"}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2019-03-14 08:02:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ok, so I would even suggest removing the octavia bits from the sample file altogether. IMO users wanting to deploy with ML2/OVN using this sample should not be forced to deploy Octavia too. Instead, I'd suggest documenting the enablement of Octavia in https://docs.openstack.org/networking-ovn/latest/admin/loadbalancer.html in a different way that does not rely on this sample file."}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2019-03-14 08:05:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Sorry, ignore part of my last comment. The file used to render the sample local.conf in https://docs.openstack.org/networking-ovn/latest/admin/loadbalancer.html is a different sample.'}, {'account_id': 17776, 'date': '2019-03-18 13:14:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Can be aborted now?
We can disable Octavia with OCTAVIA_NODE=API here and disabling o-hm0 , isnt it?'}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2020-01-03 13:51:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

networking-ovn master branch accepts no new patches anymore. The code has been merged into Neutron tree. Please re-propose the patch against Neutron if you think it's still relevant."}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2020-04-30 14:54:02.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

The master branch has been closed'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-13 08:38:51.000000000', 'message': "devstack: Disable Octavia from local.conf sample file

If the sample local.conf file is used to deploy Devstack, FIP
traffic is not working and the VM can't access to the internet
as the default gateway is set through octavia interface.

This patch is disabling Octavia services for now.

Change-Id: Ia3c80125a93979384d27b295487e5580b06ed8f7
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
devstack: Disable Octavia from local.conf sample file

If the sample local.conf file is used to deploy Devstack, FIP
traffic is not working and the VM can't access to the internet
as the default gateway is set through octavia interface.

This patch is disabling Octavia services for now.

Change-Id: Ia3c80125a93979384d27b295487e5580b06ed8f7
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Enable MySQL Cluster Support for networking_ovn

This enables the usage of the mysql_enable_ndb setting from oslo.db
from bug 1564110.This allows operators to select from MySQL (InnoDB)
or MySQL Cluster (NDB) as the storage engine backend.

Depends-On: I597d6ab50fe117e725f1d8de9b359ac9fbb79eb3
Depends-On: I9f1fd2a87fdf75332de2339d3ff4f08ce9220dcf
Change-Id: I3ad415a1802b773320f3e9a51a535f0866dbb88e
Implements: blueprint mysql-cluster-support

This change removes the use of pep517 from our tox environments. This is being
done because we're running into gate/check problems caused by it. This change
is simply a transitional stop gap and should be reverted once we can fully

commit_message:
Disable the use of pep517

This change removes the use of pep517 from our tox environments. This is being
done because we're running into gate/check problems caused by it. This change
is simply a transitional stop gap and should be reverted once we can fully
understand the issues causing the errors `has no attribute '__legacy__'`.

Change-Id: Ida44c0eafa693d07e56be8f41aa4078c72dad857
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Disable use of site packages with molecule jobs

Using virtualenvs with site-packages can cause installation failures
as ones described in bug below.

Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1876073
Change-Id: I872148b962c5db0780c3a1fd41cb928cb3404f51

commit_message:
radvd as timesever

Run chronyd as timeserver for clients on the provsioning
network. The cloud hosting OVB might not have external
IPv6 connectivity so we need a local timeserver for
OVB baremetal instances with IPv6 only.

Change-Id: I52eb326fa98c2089f6118ba4a4a575872abab2dc

commit_message:
Fix sudoers entry used by the monasca-agent checks

This change corrects the sudoers entry for the
monasca-agent user. The patch adds /bin/ip and
/usr/bin/ovs-vsctl as those are used by the
libvirt and ovs monasca-agent checks.

Change-Id: I0d8dee2db1c565be8d28d4f5ba5777c487f02293

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-26 09:16:16.000000000', 'message': 'Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: Ife344f9fba2ef00077b0d8f21f17a8a7d09f2822
'}]
commit_message:
Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: Ife344f9fba2ef00077b0d8f21f17a8a7d09f2822

commit_message:
image/builder/buildah: support Containerfile

In the podman/buildah world, we now support the Containerfile name to
replace the Dockerfile. The structure is the same, just the file name is
different; where instead of saying docker we say container.

Change-Id: I7eff40b7125d04eadfa92a97d7265b6ec713690a

commit_message:
Add mirroring for SIG and other misc repos

Original change adding per-repo GitHub mirroring to official OpenStack
repositories was missing repositories from SIGs, UC, board and TC.

Only remaining openstack/* repositories without the job now are legacy
repositories like openstack/dragonflow.

Change-Id: I4ca341f38ebb0f542fbcd03d0ffe9ac5473c55d9

will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when

'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I4e015efcd416f27fcef23e2ddee175a360a72837

commit_message:
infra-package-needs: drop ntp for Focal

systemd timesyncd is the default mechanism for timesync on Focal;
let's reduce our modification footprint by not overinstalling ntp or
trying to enable it.

Change-Id: I60e15b9101511e9008159b7a0b63f1b4b3febb96

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I11464568a24d2d79a069a72428e48207c0790fb2

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-29 11:24:04.000000000', 'message': '[ovn] Add PortBinding delete event for external ports

The ports are unbound from chassis before they get deleted after VM with
normal virtual ports is deleted. In case of SRIOV, we do not unbound the
external SRIOV port but we delete it right away with chassis column set.
This patch adds an event to detect SRIOV port deletion to be able to
cleanup metadata datapath in case the port was the last one on given
chassis.

Change-Id: I17b71933b8c3a7609fcc5027c246f5b03d493ee2
Closes-Bug: #1875865
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-04-29 11:33:21.000000000', 'message': '[ovn] Add PortBinding delete event for external ports

The ports are unbound from chassis before they get deleted after VM with

This patch adds an event to detect SRIOV port deletion to be able to

Change-Id: I17b71933b8c3a7609fcc5027c246f5b03d493ee2

The ports are unbound from chassis before they get deleted after VM with
normal virtual ports is deleted. In case of SRIOV, we do not unbound the
external SRIOV port but we delete it right away with chassis column set.

This patch adds DELETE event type support to the event that tears down

Change-Id: I17b71933b8c3a7609fcc5027c246f5b03d493ee2
Closes-Bug: #1875865
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-04-29 13:15:25.000000000', 'message': '[ovn] Add PortBinding delete event for external ports

The ports are unbound from chassis before they get deleted after VM with
normal VIF ports is deleted. In case of SRIOV, we do not unbound the
external SRIOV port but we delete it right away with chassis column set.

This patch adds DELETE event type support to the event that tears down
the metadata datapath. Also a warning is added if bound port that is not
external is being removed.

Change-Id: I17b71933b8c3a7609fcc5027c246f5b03d493ee2
Closes-Bug: #1875865
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
[ovn] Add PortBinding delete event for external ports

The ports are unbound from chassis before they get deleted after VM with
normal VIF ports is deleted. In case of SRIOV, we do not unbound the
external SRIOV port but we delete it right away with chassis column set.

This patch adds DELETE event type support to the event that tears down
the metadata datapath. Also a warning is added if bound port that is not
external is being removed.

Change-Id: I17b71933b8c3a7609fcc5027c246f5b03d493ee2
Closes-Bug: #1875865
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update hacking version to 1.1.x

This commit updates hacking version in test-requirements
and fixes some related pep8 issues

Also ignores false positive bandit test
B105: hardcoded_password_string,
B106: hardcoded_password_funcarg
based on variable or argument names.
For more info refer [1][2]

[1] https://bandit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/b105_hardcoded_password_string.html
[2] https://bandit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/plugins/b106_hardcoded_password_funcarg.html

Change-Id: If779ebad11926594961577e0744093a8ba691610
Story: 2004930
Task: 29314
(cherry picked from commit 3404a6df722b8f85c425d15769a0e831891cdc2c)

commit_message:
Use cluster name for fixed_network instead of private

At present, when a fixed_network is not specified, it is given the name
"private" by default. When multiple clusters are created, we end up in a
situation where we end up with multiple networks all with the same name.
This PS intends to make it easier to see where the resources belong to
by using the cluster name.

Story: 2007460
Task: 39139

commit_message:
Fix dsvm-functional and cleanup tox.ini

Remove unnecessary things from tox.ini:
- install_command: it's better to use the built-in install command
- VIRTUAL_ENV: this is set anyways
- sitepackages: it's enough to use virtualenv's packages

Besides these seem to be unnecessary 'sitepackages' setting started to
break functional job with an error message that there are missing
packages, however those were installed. By removing sitepackages=True
setting the errors dissapear.

Closes-Bug: #1876028
Change-Id: Ifc4904fa89eb7fcaaa8cd623112f419ac57ea286

Tweak behaviour for release selector

Unset source_config_key to trigger behaviour in charms.openstack
that does not rely on openstack-origin configuration.

commit_message:
Improve VLAN allocations synchronization

In order to reduce the number of elements retrieved from the DB, this
patch, before processing the VLAN allocations per physical network,
deleted those registers belonging to any unconfigured physical network.

The VLAN registers per physical network are deleted using a bulk delete
operation, to speed up the process.

Those missing VLAN registers per network are now created using a bulk
insert operation, available in the ORM. This bulk operation speeds up
the sync process.

Conflicts:
      neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/type_vlan.py

Change-Id: I8568e2277e157754aaff87a059a40e34e6a43e2b
Partial-Bug: #1862178
(cherry picked from commit 016e7826f165e69c3956375fc3aa8b8d642c9dc9)
(cherry picked from commit 651eb12bec5e5e986bed79f3a5c006c617e79bda)
(cherry picked from commit 4fff732b76ee5d9a4917901b33ce80ccafb5203f)

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support and docs

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Switch to using sphinx-build; fix warnings found:
  convert unreferenced footnote into normal link
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version, update some other versions as
  needed
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine; cleanup
  for python3 only

Change-Id: If18af73f3886ad32622801193f7f7ae53458b50c

See my comment above about getting testing for free.  Looks like you get what you pay for!'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-04-02 20:47:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Review-Priority+1

OK, the test isn't completely useless.  If you look in the cinder-api log [0] you can see req-abcec0bf-5c73-47ac-9a91-debdc74fb569 making the revert-to-snapshot call.  If you look for that request ID in the cinder-vol log [1], you can find these lines:

Start to perform revert to snapshot process.

connecting to cinder@ceph (conf=/etc/ceph/ceph.conf, timeout=-1). {{(pid=28452) _do_conn /opt/stack/cinder/cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py:435}}

Volume 00ba1f96-183e-402b-b2c9-b6e7ec37e48c reverted to snapshot 056827a5-1879-463f-af72-d33e0e63ae94 successfully.


So it looks like this patch functions as intended.

[0] https://storage.gra.cloud.ovh.net/v1/AUTH_dcaab5e32b234d56b626f72581e3644c/zuul_opendev_logs_223/710334/5/check/cinder-plugin-ceph-tempest/2232843/controller/logs/screen-c-api.txt

[1] https://storage.gra.cloud.ovh.net/v1/AUTH_dcaab5e32b234d56b626f72581e3644c/zuul_opendev_logs_223/710334/5/check/cinder-plugin-ceph-tempest/2232843/controller/logs/screen-c-vol.txt"}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-04-02 21:20:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
RBD: add support for revert-to-snapshot

We note here that although this operation is implemented in the
Ceph backend, the Ceph docs indicate that it is inefficient and the
preferred method of returning to a known previous state is to clone
from a snapshot.  However, this is properly a backend operation, and
it does not make sense to try to do it better in the driver than it
can be done on the backend.

Co-authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>
Implements: bp rbd-revert-to-snapshot
Change-Id: If8a5eb3a03e18f9043ff29f7648234c9b46376a0

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-27 11:02:53.000000000', 'message': 'Remove nameservers with any IP in overcloud resolv.conf workaround

Kayobe has a workaround for CentOS cloud images which contain a bogus
nameserver entry in /etc/resolv.conf. By setting
overcloud_host_image_workaround_resolv_enabled to true, the entry would
be removed. Previously we removed a specific IP address - 10.0.2.3 -
that was present in the CentOS 7 images. However, it seems that CentOS 8
images have a different IP - 192.168.122.1.

This change fixes the issue and becomes resilient to future changes by
matching any IP address. This should be fairly safe, since this
workaround is opt-in.

Change-Id: I9323a38cb2bb627ff56f5713900be00595ea8d4b
Story: 2006574
Task: 39484
(cherry picked from commit dcd5159c172f50b9708cb146e4f3a11060dee243)
'}, {'created': '2020-04-28 19:51:48.000000000', 'message': 'Remove nameservers with any IP in overcloud resolv.conf workaround

overcloud_host_image_workaround_resolv_enabled to true, the entry would
be removed. Previously we removed a specific IP address - 10.0.2.3 -
that was present in the CentOS 7 images. However, it seems that CentOS 8
images have a different IP - 192.168.122.1.

This change fixes the issue and becomes resilient to future changes by
matching any IP address. This should be fairly safe, since this

commit_message:
Remove nameservers with any IP in overcloud resolv.conf workaround

Kayobe has a workaround for CentOS cloud images which contain a bogus
nameserver entry in /etc/resolv.conf. By setting
overcloud_host_image_workaround_resolv_enabled to true, the entry would
be removed. Previously we removed a specific IP address - 10.0.2.3 -
that was present in the CentOS 7 images. However, it seems that CentOS 8
images have a different IP - 192.168.122.1.

This change fixes the issue and becomes resilient to future changes by
matching any IP address. This should be fairly safe, since this
workaround is opt-in.

Change-Id: I9323a38cb2bb627ff56f5713900be00595ea8d4b
Story: 2006574
Task: 39484
(cherry picked from commit dcd5159c172f50b9708cb146e4f3a11060dee243)

commit_message:
Do not copy /sbin/ip to /usr/bin/monasa-agent-ip

This patch removes the code that does the copy of /sbin/ip to
/usr/bin/monasca-agent-ip. There is a limitation with /sbin/ip
that limits copying it to a new name that is longer than
2 characters. The error is:

./monasca-agent-ip a
Object "nasca-agent-ip" is unknown, try "ip help".

As this is not working on RHEL,SLES, or Ubuntu this code
should be removed.

Change-Id: I439be00070eb1cf16416325f23a86fc7cd518acc
Story: 2001593
Task: 6543
(cherry picked from commit 17ba1346b7d3cdc6914442465ed172518cb81d30)

commit_message:
Do not copy /sbin/ip to /usr/bin/monasa-agent-ip

This patch removes the code that does the copy of /sbin/ip to
/usr/bin/monasca-agent-ip. There is a limitation with /sbin/ip
that limits copying it to a new name that is longer than
2 characters. The error is:

./monasca-agent-ip a
Object "nasca-agent-ip" is unknown, try "ip help".

As this is not working on RHEL,SLES, or Ubuntu this code
should be removed.

Change-Id: I439be00070eb1cf16416325f23a86fc7cd518acc
Story: 2001593
Task: 6543
(cherry picked from commit 17ba1346b7d3cdc6914442465ed172518cb81d30)

This lgtm but I think we need to run some functional and upgrade testing. Since the option defaults to False, none of the existing tests are going to cover having it enabled. The feature was released in Nova with Train along with the necessary upgrade bits so it should be safe to enable in existing Train deployments but i think we need to prove that out with some test coverage.'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2020-04-05 13:19:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

This is a good start, but needs a few more things before it's ready.

* If the flag is set to True, and the version of openstack is < train, then it would be useful to log this fact as an ERROR to the Log, and also indicate on the status line that the charm has incorrect configuration.
* A release note patch to the charm-guide for 20.05 that indicates what the param is, what it does, and links to the relevant OpenStack documentation.  Then link that in the commit msg here.  This ensures that new features are announced to the community of users.

Thanks again."}, {'account_id': 10366, 'date': '2020-04-09 11:50:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10366, 'date': '2020-04-09 11:54:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 10366, 'date': '2020-04-09 12:01:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Ed, Functional test case is added. Upgrade testing is done manually, attached the results here https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-placement/+bug/1864859/comments/3'}, {'account_id': 10366, 'date': '2020-04-09 12:04:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

 > OpenStack documentation.  Then link that in the commit msg here.

 > users.
 > 
 > Thanks again.

Alex,
Modifications are done as requested. Only open question is currently the charm is blocked if the quota-count-usage-from-placement parameter is set to True for OpenStack releases < train. Is the charm supposed to be blocked or it should be soft warning?
Thanks for your comments."}, {'account_id': 2424, 'date': '2020-04-13 22:43:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

My 2 cents on "Is the charm supposed to be blocked or it should be soft warning?" is that yes, the correct status is blocked since it requires a operator's interaction to fix this.'}, {'account_id': 2424, 'date': '2020-04-13 22:43:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2020-04-14 11:28:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

>  Is the charm supposed to be blocked or it should be soft warning?

I may be slightly at odds with Filipe (sorry Filipe!) but my general decision on whether to be 'blocked' or just put a note in the status ine (and log to status), is whether the charm can make progress or not.

i.e. If the configuration item set to the 'wrong' value for the Ubuntu release means that the payload can't be configured and launched, then the charm status should be 'blocked'.  If it just can't be used (i.e. ignored) then the charm should log the error, but still configure the payload and continue, but indicate on the status line that there is a problem."}, {'account_id': 10366, 'date': '2020-04-15 10:11:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 10366, 'date': '2020-04-15 10:12:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Add new config option to set [quota].count_usage_from_placement

New config option count_usage_from_placement is added in Nova from
Train release to enable/disable counting of quota usage from placement
service. Corresponding config parameter is required in nova-cloud-controller
charm.

This patch introduces quota-count-usage-from-placement config parameter in
nova-cloud-controller charm. For openstack releases train or above, this
option is rendered in nova.conf for nova-cloud-controller units.

func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/250
Change-Id: I57b9335b7b6aecb8610a66a59cb2e4e506e76a5e
Closes-Bug: #1864859

commit_message:
Remove the dependency on the "mock" package

Now that we are python3 only, we should move to using the built
in version of mock that supports all of our testing needs and
remove the dependency on the "mock" package.

This patch moves all references to "import mock" to
"from unittest import mock". It also cleans up some new line
inconsistency.

Fixed an inconsistency in the OVSBridge.deferred() definition
as it needs to also have an *args argument.

Fixed an issue where an l3-agent test was mocking
functools.partial, causing a python3.8 failure.

Unit tests only, removing from tests/base.py affects
functional tests which need additional work.

Change-Id: I40e8a8410840c3774c72ae1a8054574445d66ece

commit_message:
Removes info about deleted function should_cache_fn

should_cache_fn function is removed from keystone when oslo_cache
was adopted. A function still mentions about it. This patch updates
the doc string mentioning about should_cache_fn.

Change-Id: Ib9693f1c020e0ed251d4119c0fbf8ffef693102a

is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for victoria.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

commit_message:
Explicitly handle oslo_context in to_primitive

the RequestContext entities may be badly serializable as is,
but they have a to_dict() method that can be used for that.

Change-Id: I4880d209483c47a81a3a310f514546b363da4697
Related-Bug: #1720486

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: If7f1f31ad2ab284d000057a4360170db8e4855e9

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: I99097f959d314f4a7867463d41a9c5a8817fd06b
Sem-Ver: feature

messages:
[{'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2020-02-18 13:04:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2020-02-18 13:16:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

15:06 < marios|ruck> weshay|ruck: looks like it fails straight away again :/ 
                     https://ci.centos.org/job/tripleo-quickstart-extras-gate-master-delorean-full-featureset052/3819/console'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2020-02-18 13:19:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

15:06 < zbr> marios|ruck: here is the deal: newer virtualenv needs newer pip and setuptools, something we do NOT have on centos-7
15:07 < zbr> for tox testing that is not a big deal, but install-deps,... is another story, as it may alter the system support status.
15:07 < zbr> i think we may install newer virtualenv if we use --no-deps
15:07 < zbr> but we need to test if it still works after.
15:08 < zbr> we need to be sure we do not upgrade any other python modules when we install virtualenv from pip
15:08 < zbr> the only way to do this is to use nodeps option.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2020-02-18 14:20:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2020-02-18 14:20:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

In any case sorin said we need to update other things (see previous comments here today from me copy/pasted from irc) still to get that virtualenv.

Another thing I might do is restore https://review.opendev.org/#/c/707062/19/bindep.txt and get platform virtualenv does that mean latest ? maybe so i'll include that too"}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2020-02-18 15:31:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2020-04-30 09:17:14.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

commit_message:
Install virtualenv >= 20.0.4 & bump molecule remove six workaround

Latest virtualenv 20.0.4 fixes [1] issues that required pinning
molecule/virtualenv/six. This updates to get the latest virtualenv
removes the six installation and bumps molecule to 3.0a9

[1] https://virtualenv.pypa.io/en/latest/changelog.html#bugfixes-20-0-4
Related-Bug: 1863632
Related-Bug: 1862941
Related-Bug: 1862724
Change-Id: I20543952ec4ad3e1ff648e32d600324bb09d9336

commit_message:
Create stable/ussuri for ironic

This creates the stable/ussuri branch point for the
ironic deliverable. Please ack with +1, or if there
is some reason to hold off leave a -1.

Patches without feedback will be approved by May 1.

Change-Id: I0b11aec1c4945b83b8883ec12659784420f4a201
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-27 18:55:07.000000000', 'message': 'Do not copy /sbin/ip to /usr/bin/monasa-agent-ip

This patch removes the code that does the copy of /sbin/ip to
/usr/bin/monasca-agent-ip. There is a limitation with /sbin/ip
that limits copying it to a new name that is longer than
2 characters. The error is:

./monasca-agent-ip a
Object "nasca-agent-ip" is unknown, try "ip help".

As this is not working on RHEL,SLES, or Ubuntu this code
should be removed.

Change-Id: I439be00070eb1cf16416325f23a86fc7cd518acc
Story: 2001593
Task: 6543
(cherry picked from commit 17ba1346b7d3cdc6914442465ed172518cb81d30)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not copy /sbin/ip to /usr/bin/monasa-agent-ip

This patch removes the code that does the copy of /sbin/ip to
/usr/bin/monasca-agent-ip. There is a limitation with /sbin/ip
that limits copying it to a new name that is longer than
2 characters. The error is:

./monasca-agent-ip a
Object "nasca-agent-ip" is unknown, try "ip help".

As this is not working on RHEL,SLES, or Ubuntu this code
should be removed.

Change-Id: I439be00070eb1cf16416325f23a86fc7cd518acc
Story: 2001593
Task: 6543
(cherry picked from commit 17ba1346b7d3cdc6914442465ed172518cb81d30)

commit_message:
Check for InternalApi in role for HostnameResolveNetwork

It's possible that some custom roles don't have InternalApi
network. Fallback to ctlplane/provisioning in those cases.

Change-Id: I385cd695bba0e3ec159f10d5ef87ee186cf29734
Closes-Bug: #1874330

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-29 17:47:50.000000000', 'message': 'tripleo-quickstart fails due to python-pip

The python-pip package was renamed in EPEL to reflect python version,
which causes the quickstart installer to fail early on CentOS 7 due to
inability to find the correct package. Editing the name to python2-pip
in bindep.txt seems to fix the issue per local tests.

Change-Id: If737085d7a27afca9de3357be29f7ef303452dfa
Closes-bug: #1830956
'}]
commit_message:
tripleo-quickstart fails due to python-pip

The python-pip package was renamed in EPEL to reflect python version,
which causes the quickstart installer to fail early on CentOS 7 due to
inability to find the correct package. Editing the name to python2-pip
in bindep.txt seems to fix the issue per local tests.

Change-Id: If737085d7a27afca9de3357be29f7ef303452dfa
Closes-bug: #1830956

commit_message:
Explicitly install inspector-dnsmasq package

The package used to be implicitly pulled before [1],
now this needs to be installed explicitly.

Changed inspector_package param to contain list of packages
to install and adopted package module to handle list
of packages.

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/23761/

Change-Id: I2435b476b65be5aab6e35bad0834e60dc9c8ced5
(cherry picked from commit b1ea700ba8a842125576f6882312a9ba50511916)

commit_message:
[DNM] Add job configuration to test next minor release

This set of configuration was used to test cento minor update to 7.7
We can leave the job configuration now, even if inactive so the next
minor release we can reactivate the jobs and test that nothing is
breaking us
This patch enables an update on the undercloud image to Centos CR repo,
which if present will contain the updates to the patches for the next
minor release before starting the workflow

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/618832
Change-Id: I26aae898f31e3187368674866f24d91a08824748

I'd like to hold on to this and it's related patch until I can run a multinode test on the latest master. The standalone scenario 10 isn't actually showing this error at the moment and while it is a little different than the multinode job, I would expect a similar failure."}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2019-03-18 17:53:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> (1 comment)

I believe you are correct, I fixed a typo here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/634286/5/playbooks/octavia-files.yaml.'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2019-03-22 11:49:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2019-03-22 12:41:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

According to the docs, the osc will look for a clouds.yaml in 

    Current Directory
    ~/.config/openstack
    /etc/openstack

Could be that in u/s CI, the the home directory where .config/openstack is getting dropped is /home/zuul? Since the playbook is running the ansible as the stack user it is probably looking in the wrong spot and then tries /etc/openstack where it doesn't have permissions to look. If that is true, I wonder if it is possible to parameterize the remote_user in a meaningful way."}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2019-03-25 08:02:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 29222, 'date': '2019-03-25 08:52:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2019-03-25 12:08:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

> (2 comments)

+1 on that. Let's update the commit message to reflect that and remove the bogus link to logs. I've tried a few things here and the root cause appears to be that the openstack client needs to load a clouds.yaml. There is probably one in the /home/zuul/.config/openstack but the ansible env doesn't know to look there apparently. The only one left is /etc/openstack/clouds.yaml and only root has read access. The way I see it, the alternatives are:
 - make it so the calls to the openstack client performed so that $HOME is the undercloud user so that the openstack client reads [undercloud user]/.config/openstack/clouds.yaml
- make /etc/openstack and /etc/openstack/clouds.yaml readable to the ansible through permissions
- make the ansible run as root"}, {'account_id': 11082, 'date': '2019-03-27 09:12:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-07-11 13:46:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

please add these changes to tripleo-ansible, these playbooks have already been ported over and are being removed from here.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2020-04-30 08:48:14.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Run keypair creating as root

If the user does not have admin permissions creating keypair is going to
fail with [1][2] to fix that we can call it with become=true

Related-Bug: #1815872

[1] [Errno 13] Permission denied: '/etc/openstack/clouds.yaml
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/71/636571/3/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario010-multinode-oooq-container/31f82be/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/overcloud_deploy.log.txt.gz

Change-Id: Ibfe05c08182a483a5900eb166a059e4b098a4454

subject: Revert shebang fix in check-run-nova-compute↲
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23811, 'name': 'Oliver Walsh', 'email': 'owalsh@redhat.com', 'username': 'owalsh'}, {'_account_id': 24162, 'name': 'Sorin Sbârnea', 'display_name': 'zbr', 'email': 'ssbarnea@redhat.com', 'username': 'ssbarnea', 'status': 'do not feed the troll 🥕'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2019-01-07 08:06:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-01-07 09:59:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-01-07 12:20:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Shabang line does not support command parameters on most platforms.

I think that instead of removing the sheband is would be better to remove the -utt which is not mandatory.

The same feature can be implemented using env-vars or at runtime, and is clearly not a requirement for the script execution.

So, I vote for using a shebang based on env, but removing the -utt.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2019-01-07 13:47:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Shabang line does not support command parameters on most platforms.

Do you have any reference for this? https://linux.die.net/man/2/execve

Also this reverts to the previous behaviour which was known to work.
If we decide to remove it, that is fine, but it should be done in a separate
review explaining the rationale.
 
 > I think that instead of removing the sheband is would be better to
 > remove the -utt which is not mandatory.
 > 
 > The same feature can be implemented using env-vars or at runtime,
 > and is clearly not a requirement for the script execution.
 > 
 > So, I vote for using a shebang based on env, but removing the -utt.

We are removing the env for the reasons explained in the commit message.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2019-01-07 13:47:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

check-rdo'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2019-01-08 10:10:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

check-rdo'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-01-08 11:20:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

https://unix.stackexchange.com/questions/399690/multiple-arguments-in-shebang provides more information about the limitations of shebang.

I do consider the use of 'env' useful because it allows correct use of current python interpreter in virtualenvs.

Hardcoded python path is not really portable can risk of using another python version.

On the other hand, the "-utt" parameter is less important than using python from path, as code could be modified to enable warnings without it.... and avoid execution failure.

It may be confusing but "No such file or directory" was happening not because 'python' was not found, it was happening because the entire string (with the argument) was not found as file.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-01-08 11:53:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2020-04-30 08:42:49.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

bug was fixed'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-07 08:06:38.000000000', 'message': "Revert shebang fix in check-run-nova-compute↲

In I3606c356a2103ce1e26e78e1192f0713b51e1ca4 we (again) moved to using
env to detect python versions. The problem with this is that this script
gets exec'ed:

      + exec /var/lib/nova/instanceha/check-run-nova-compute
      Running command: '/var/lib/nova/instanceha/check-run-nova-compute '
      /usr/bin/env: python -utt: No such file or directory

Revert the change for this script.
Hopefully once nova is able to do this on its own we can remove this
hack.

Change-Id: I2c665b4b94b2d325e693685cd03385308a09069d
Closes-Bug: #1785245
"}]
commit_message:
Revert shebang fix in check-run-nova-compute↲

In I3606c356a2103ce1e26e78e1192f0713b51e1ca4 we (again) moved to using
env to detect python versions. The problem with this is that this script
gets exec'ed:

      + exec /var/lib/nova/instanceha/check-run-nova-compute
      Running command: '/var/lib/nova/instanceha/check-run-nova-compute '
      /usr/bin/env: python -utt: No such file or directory

Revert the change for this script.
Hopefully once nova is able to do this on its own we can remove this
hack.

Change-Id: I2c665b4b94b2d325e693685cd03385308a09069d
Closes-Bug: #1785245

commit_message:
Add disruption detector for Overcloud endpoint monitoring

This adds a disruption detector python script that hooks
into the Overcloud controller haproxy to determine when
services go down. You can use this role to determine if
any given action disrupts the overcloud services uptime.

example usage:

- name: Check if overcloud services are disrupted
  hosts: <host for test action>:controller
  roles:
    - disruption-detector
    - <role to test for disruption>

Change-Id: I22eba1a29d165625e9b1d2c3097a38617a18b7cd

Remove testresources and testscenarios from test-requirements

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: I8fea742e6abb069713dedcea62c230903cb1ff99
Sem-Ver: feature

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 10311, 'name': 'Joseph Davis', 'email': 'joseph.davis@suse.com', 'username': 'joadavis'}, {'_account_id': 12542, 'name': 'Johannes Grassler', 'email': 'jgr-launchpad@btw23.de', 'username': 'jgrassler'}, {'_account_id': 14892, 'name': 'Keith Berger', 'email': 'keith.berger@suse.com', 'username': 'kberger'}, {'_account_id': 16222, 'name': 'witek', 'email': 'witold.bedyk@suse.com', 'username': 'witek'}, {'_account_id': 17669, 'name': 'Doug Szumski', 'email': 'doug@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'DougSzumski'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 28062, 'name': 'Martin Chacon Piza', 'email': 'martin@chaconpiza.com', 'username': 'martinchacon'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 14892, 'date': '2020-04-27 18:54:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14892, 'date': '2020-04-27 20:15:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2020-04-29 16:10:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2020-04-29 20:11:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

lgtm, clean pick'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2020-04-30 08:05:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-27 18:54:50.000000000', 'message': 'Do not copy /sbin/ip to /usr/bin/monasa-agent-ip

This patch removes the code that does the copy of /sbin/ip to
/usr/bin/monasca-agent-ip. There is a limitation with /sbin/ip
that limits copying it to a new name that is longer than
2 characters. The error is:

./monasca-agent-ip a
Object "nasca-agent-ip" is unknown, try "ip help".

As this is not working on RHEL,SLES, or Ubuntu this code
should be removed.

Change-Id: I439be00070eb1cf16416325f23a86fc7cd518acc
Story: 2001593
Task: 6543
(cherry picked from commit 17ba1346b7d3cdc6914442465ed172518cb81d30)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not copy /sbin/ip to /usr/bin/monasa-agent-ip

This patch removes the code that does the copy of /sbin/ip to
/usr/bin/monasca-agent-ip. There is a limitation with /sbin/ip
that limits copying it to a new name that is longer than
2 characters. The error is:

./monasca-agent-ip a
Object "nasca-agent-ip" is unknown, try "ip help".

As this is not working on RHEL,SLES, or Ubuntu this code
should be removed.

Change-Id: I439be00070eb1cf16416325f23a86fc7cd518acc
Story: 2001593
Task: 6543
(cherry picked from commit 17ba1346b7d3cdc6914442465ed172518cb81d30)

subject: More robust hvac.Client post response handling
messages: [{'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2020-04-29 19:16:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2020-04-29 20:35:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\ncharm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2020-04-30 07:37:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-29 19:16:29.000000000', 'message': 'More robust hvac.Client post response handling

Pin the version of hvac for a consistent response type. Use the adpater
to get response code and json data.

Closes Bug: #1871981
Change-Id: Ia8517a75e7bc20f751eca83aaa84728cc62edee6
'}]
commit_message:
More robust hvac.Client post response handling

Pin the version of hvac for a consistent response type. Use the adpater
to get response code and json data.

Closes Bug: #1871981
Change-Id: Ia8517a75e7bc20f751eca83aaa84728cc62edee6

commit_message:
py3: Make etag-quoter work

Previously, func tests (might?) complain like

   TypeError: 'dict_items' object does not support item assignment

Change-Id: Ic1a81f5b7262942ea52aa1de87cfcde25a2457ba

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-24 14:11:38.000000000', 'message': 'Spawn long-running processes in the driver agent

The OVN Octavia provider driver in the OvnProviderHelper
class caches these attributes:

    ovn_nbdb_api_for_events
    ovn_nb_idl_for_events
    ovn_nbdb_api

to not re-create things each time OVN IDL that is used for
handling events is called.

We should be using the Octavia Driver Provider Agent framework
instead to not have those long-running IDLs in the API process.

This change:
- Creates driver provider agent and registers its entry point
- While setting up the driver agent instance, start IDL that
  will handle events
- Stop caching ovn_nbdb_api, ovn_nb_idl_for_events and
  ovn_nbdb_api_for_events in the OvnProviderHelper class

Conflicts:
   ovn_octavia_provider/tests/functional/test_driver.py
   ovn_octavia_provider/tests/unit/test_driver.py

Change-Id: I0034a48997bd6b95e1b51bfcbd56e8372b35e62f
Closes-bug: #1871355
(cherry picked from commit c6cee9207349a12e499cbc81fe0e5d4d5bfa015c)

commit_message:
Spawn long-running processes in the driver agent

The OVN Octavia provider driver in the OvnProviderHelper
class caches these attributes:

    ovn_nbdb_api_for_events
    ovn_nb_idl_for_events
    ovn_nbdb_api

to not re-create things each time OVN IDL that is used for
handling events is called.

We should be using the Octavia Driver Provider Agent framework
instead to not have those long-running IDLs in the API process.

This change:
- Creates driver provider agent and registers its entry point
- While setting up the driver agent instance, start IDL that
  will handle events
- Stop caching ovn_nbdb_api, ovn_nb_idl_for_events and
  ovn_nbdb_api_for_events in the OvnProviderHelper class

Conflicts:
   ovn_octavia_provider/tests/functional/test_driver.py

Change-Id: I0034a48997bd6b95e1b51bfcbd56e8372b35e62f
Closes-bug: #1871355
(cherry picked from commit c6cee9207349a12e499cbc81fe0e5d4d5bfa015c)

commit_message:
Fix revert snapshot issue

While there is a related fcmap stays in 100% copying clone state,
and this volume act as target volume in fcmap relationship,
revert snapshot will fail. This fix will stop 100% copying clone
fcmap, then let revert snapshot go.

Closes-bug: #1863070

Change-Id: I6b5f6396ad5524f4086ce5192e32fd5e7fee58a2

subject: Handle empty config files
messages: [{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-04-27 19:11:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-04-27 20:02:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-04-30 06:36:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-27 19:11:20.000000000', 'message': "Handle empty config files

Current code was assuming if a reno.yaml file was found that it could
load that file to read config options. While probably a safe assumption
in the majority of cases, someone that isn't aware of this could modify
their config file to remove settings, leaving an empty or comment-only
file that when read does not actually load any yaml that can be used.

This adds protection for that to make reno does not try to use an empty
file.

Change-Id: I0ae0bcc93a79bbf66735833b654964b494485ee1
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Handle empty config files

Current code was assuming if a reno.yaml file was found that it could
load that file to read config options. While probably a safe assumption
in the majority of cases, someone that isn't aware of this could modify
their config file to remove settings, leaving an empty or comment-only
file that when read does not actually load any yaml that can be used.

This adds protection for that to make reno does not try to use an empty
file.

Change-Id: I0ae0bcc93a79bbf66735833b654964b494485ee1
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-28 17:32:32.000000000', 'message': 'Release manila 8.1.2 off of stable/stein

Includes fixes for:
- Bug #1872873 (scheduler tally of in-flight usages)
- Bug #1872872 (finite user quotas with inf project quotas)
- Bug #1858328 (driver shrink behavior)
- Bug #1848889 (netapp share replication)
- Bug #1706137 (netapp QoS)
- Bug #1869712 (expensive calculation in scheduler)
- Bug #1870751 (group and share type access list)
- Bug #1699836 (type deletion with open group types)
- Bug #1707084 (netapp extra specs)
- Bug #1869148 (extension APIs in pyc files)

Change-Id: I01f251de2febf9a1253be8282830ccac186cabe3
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Release manila 8.1.2 off of stable/stein

Includes fixes for:
- Bug #1872873 (scheduler tally of in-flight usages)
- Bug #1872872 (finite user quotas with inf project quotas)
- Bug #1858328 (driver shrink behavior)
- Bug #1848889 (netapp share replication)
- Bug #1706137 (netapp QoS)
- Bug #1869712 (expensive calculation in scheduler)
- Bug #1870751 (group and share type access list)
- Bug #1699836 (type deletion with open group types)
- Bug #1707084 (netapp extra specs)
- Bug #1869148 (extension APIs in pyc files)

Change-Id: I01f251de2febf9a1253be8282830ccac186cabe3
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

subject: Add support to specify multiple values for filter options
messages: [{'account_id': 27302, 'date': '2020-02-12 16:09:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27302, 'date': '2020-02-13 09:22:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 27302, 'date': '2020-02-13 09:25:29.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from list-segment-associated-to-host to bug/1854903'}, {'account_id': 27302, 'date': '2020-02-13 09:30:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 27302, 'date': '2020-02-17 14:51:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-12 16:09:34.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for multiple filters

This patch add support to read multiple options of filter
(recovery_method|service_type) for listing FailoverSegments.

Change-Id: I834f11e2cb3d147150dd28150bc79d4b6c99ae35
Closes-Bug: #1854903
Depends-On: I3f3f2a25824263ef89d6be27f78bf92dfbc2a9a0
'}, {'created': '2020-02-13 09:22:41.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for multiple filters

This patch add support to read multiple options of filter
(recovery_method|service_type) for listing FailoverSegments.

Change-Id: I834f11e2cb3d147150dd28150bc79d4b6c99ae35
Closes-Bug: #1854903
Depends-On: I3f3f2a25824263ef89d6be27f78bf92dfbc2a9a0
'}, {'created': '2020-02-13 09:30:28.000000000', 'message': "Add support to specify multiple values for filter options

Previously, if user passes recovery_method query parameter as
auto,reserved_host, then, it wasn't returning failover segments with
recovery method auto and reserved_host. It was treating
`auto,reserved_host` as one recovery method. This patch parsed multiple
filters request as a list.

Change-Id: I834f11e2cb3d147150dd28150bc79d4b6c99ae35
Closes-Bug: #1854903
Depends-On: I3f3f2a25824263ef89d6be27f78bf92dfbc2a9a0
"}, {'created': '2020-02-17 14:51:08.000000000', 'message': "Add support to specify multiple values for filter options

Previously, if user passes recovery_method query parameter as
auto,reserved_host, then, it wasn't returning failover segments with
recovery method auto and reserved_host. It was treating
`auto,reserved_host` as one recovery method. This patch parsed multiple
filters request as a list.

Change-Id: I834f11e2cb3d147150dd28150bc79d4b6c99ae35
Closes-Bug: #1854903
Depends-On: I3f3f2a25824263ef89d6be27f78bf92dfbc2a9a0
"}]
commit_message:
Add support to specify multiple values for filter options

Previously, if user passes recovery_method query parameter as
auto,reserved_host, then, it wasn't returning failover segments with
recovery method auto and reserved_host. It was treating
`auto,reserved_host` as one recovery method. This patch parsed multiple
filters request as a list.

Change-Id: I834f11e2cb3d147150dd28150bc79d4b6c99ae35
Closes-Bug: #1854903
Depends-On: I3f3f2a25824263ef89d6be27f78bf92dfbc2a9a0

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: Ifaf75a60fa59a073eea00d44cc339c371151465e
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Fix fake attribute old interface

In the v2 version, the fake attribute does not need to be
initialized with deployable. The deployable fake field
does not contain the necessary information for attribute
initialization. This patch will solve this problem.

Change-Id: Ifa9ecf75157b377ea544ba60c6c51fab2bda663c

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-27 21:37:11.000000000', 'message': "Call row.verify() when updating map columns with db_set

The verify() method will ensure that if the row's column in the db
has changed since we set it, that we will be notified and try the
transaction again with new values. This is important when we do a
read-update operation like we do for map columns in db_set. Since
we read the values add a few keys, then overwrite the whole value,
it is important that we don't do that if we have stale data.

Since ovs 2.6, there has been a setkey() operation that would
allow modifying a map w/o overwriting the whole value, but there
is a bug where it doesn't handle maps that have a refTable value
like Qos.queues. So using that before it is fixed [1] and all
packages have picked it up would cause breakage.

[1] https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/1254735/

Closes-bug: #1867652
Change-Id: Ic898cefb4ced76e9e169b9f5d6caaace600abb0c
(cherry picked from commit b92d8742bf3f5e436bcb9160618b343e3c4595fa)

commit_message:
Call row.verify() when updating map columns with db_set

The verify() method will ensure that if the row's column in the db
has changed since we set it, that we will be notified and try the
transaction again with new values. This is important when we do a
read-update operation like we do for map columns in db_set. Since
we read the values add a few keys, then overwrite the whole value,
it is important that we don't do that if we have stale data.

Since ovs 2.6, there has been a setkey() operation that would
allow modifying a map w/o overwriting the whole value, but there
is a bug where it doesn't handle maps that have a refTable value
like Qos.queues. So using that before it is fixed [1] and all
packages have picked it up would cause breakage.

[1] https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/1254735/

Closes-bug: #1867652
Change-Id: Ic898cefb4ced76e9e169b9f5d6caaace600abb0c
(cherry picked from commit b92d8742bf3f5e436bcb9160618b343e3c4595fa)
(cherry picked from commit 5fec1d724461e24206e2c1f66ad6ba8e342d4879)

commit_message:
Call row.verify() when updating map columns with db_set

The verify() method will ensure that if the row's column in the db
has changed since we set it, that we will be notified and try the
transaction again with new values. This is important when we do a
read-update operation like we do for map columns in db_set. Since
we read the values add a few keys, then overwrite the whole value,
it is important that we don't do that if we have stale data.

Since ovs 2.6, there has been a setkey() operation that would
allow modifying a map w/o overwriting the whole value, but there
is a bug where it doesn't handle maps that have a refTable value
like Qos.queues. So using that before it is fixed [1] and all
packages have picked it up would cause breakage.

[1] https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/1254735/

Closes-bug: #1867652

commit_message:
Call row.verify() when updating map columns with db_set

The verify() method will ensure that if the row's column in the db
has changed since we set it, that we will be notified and try the
transaction again with new values. This is important when we do a
read-update operation like we do for map columns in db_set. Since
we read the values add a few keys, then overwrite the whole value,
it is important that we don't do that if we have stale data.

Since ovs 2.6, there has been a setkey() operation that would
allow modifying a map w/o overwriting the whole value, but there
is a bug where it doesn't handle maps that have a refTable value
like Qos.queues. So using that before it is fixed [1] and all
packages have picked it up would cause breakage.

[1] https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/1254735/

Closes-bug: #1867652
Change-Id: Ic898cefb4ced76e9e169b9f5d6caaace600abb0c
(cherry picked from commit b92d8742bf3f5e436bcb9160618b343e3c4595fa)
(cherry picked from commit 5fec1d724461e24206e2c1f66ad6ba8e342d4879)

subject: Bump default tox env from py37 to py38
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-24 15:35:46.000000000', 'message': 'Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: Iac6ba63153af308cd82f3d3a303ce4c3fead0a5f
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: Iac6ba63153af308cd82f3d3a303ce4c3fead0a5f
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add py38 package metadata

Now that we are running the Victoria tests that include a
voting py38, we can now add the Python 3.8 metadata to the
package information to reflect that support.

Change-Id: Ia0db684e1c03231a93f71cab49cbbd4f23768dda
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2020-04-27 17:34:10.000000000', 'message': '[train-only] Ensure overcloud inventory group exists

In ussuri this changes to allovercloud to avoid conflicting with the
inventory group for the "overcloud" stack and the "allovercloud"
group refers to all overcloud nodes.
For train only we need to ensure an overcloud group exists for existing
plays. If we have an overcloud stack then it's already set, otherwise
create an alias the first stack.

Change-Id: I166647afbf2f893b8ee1981dfb01be336c8f9971
Related-bug: #1875429

commit_message:
[train-only] Ensure overcloud inventory group exists

In ussuri the "allovercloud" group instead of the "overcloud" group
refers to all overcloud nodes to avoid conflicting with the inventory
group for the "overcloud" stack.
For train only we need to ensure an "overcloud" group exists for any
existing plays that expect this group to refer to all overcloud hosts.

Change-Id: I166647afbf2f893b8ee1981dfb01be336c8f9971
Related-bug: #1875429

parameter. In case the IPA does not understand this new parameter yet,

Change-Id: Id6b51dd19e83d20dc8d6d312cbec12d09bfd76c1

For Software RAID, we need to pass the boot mode to the IPA via a new
parameter. In case the IPA does not understand this new parameter yet,

commit_message:
Don't break UEFI install with older IPAs

For Software RAID, we need to pass the boot mode to the IPA via a new
parameter. In case the IPA does not understand this new parameter yet,
we catch the error and fail for UEFI. This patch proposes to only fail
in the case of software RAID, since the older IPA can handle the general
case of UEFIi, e.g. with a whole disk image.

Change-Id: Id6b51dd19e83d20dc8d6d312cbec12d09bfd76c1

subject: [stable-only] Add retry for inserting temp_ssh_key

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-28 07:26:35.000000000', 'message': "[stable-only] Add retry for inserting temp_ssh_key

For slow nodes, we don't wait for node to boot completely after the
heat stack is CREATE/UPDATE_COMPLETE. This would ensure we try a
few times before failing.

Change-Id: Iee8f3200a3c108375c7ca296734db1a51914cd69
Closes-Bug: #1873892
"}, {'created': '2020-04-28 14:43:37.000000000', 'message': "[stable-only] Add retry for inserting temp_ssh_key

For slow nodes, we don't wait for node to boot completely after the
heat stack is CREATE/UPDATE_COMPLETE. This would ensure we try a
few times before failing.

Also bumps tenacity lower-constraints.

Change-Id: Iee8f3200a3c108375c7ca296734db1a51914cd69
Closes-Bug: #1873892

For slow nodes, we don't wait for node to boot completely after the

commit_message:
[stable-only] Add retry for inserting temp_ssh_key

For slow nodes, we don't wait for node to boot completely after the
heat stack is CREATE/UPDATE_COMPLETE. This would ensure we try a
few times before failing.

Adds tenacity to requirements and bumps lower-constraints.

Change-Id: Iee8f3200a3c108375c7ca296734db1a51914cd69
Closes-Bug: #1873892

commit_message:
Upgrade flake8-import-order version to 0.17.1

Full py3 compatible version.
Add all Python3 modules to stdlib list.
Also includes fix to an enum34 dependency bug.

This requires pointing the hash for the functional test to a newer
commit in ironic-inspector repo, and adjusting the functional
test to take into consideration the added scope to the
introspection rules.

Change-Id: Ifa42ffaf97d6e2651b305374c216937ae276e8b7

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Icdf6f01aaefd12f31f1046f527a99b0021fbd39a
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Icdf6f01aaefd12f31f1046f527a99b0021fbd39a

commit_message:
Fix spurious test failure

idlutils.wait_for_change can be called several times depending on
what happens w/ the thread starting. Just test that it is called at
least one time with the correct arguments.

Change-Id: I04a4a8ce44212055b08dbfc187d120a7f764e1d1
(cherry picked from commit bf2e5f38a981b07b460f06b65367fb93127fc192)

commit_message:
[Ceph-OSD] Update getting and releasing of lock

The PS moves the relese of lock out from the if-else statement.
Otherwise we are not releasing the lock in two of three cases.
And the lock will be released only if we are going though
the last "else" statement. The PS supposed to fix that.
Also it increases the timeout value.

Change-Id: I284cff06a34ddb864484d2a63780b4fdb9075a0a

commit_message:
Unbreak mock-releated autospec issue

For some reason, in stable/stein and older, the autospec=True in
this test started failing. Using python3's unittest.mock works, so
just to get this working use that if it exists.

Change-Id: I508bc07754f11165fb50f5f3f412f6191d27f8b4
Closes-bug: #1867634

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Updates for python 2.7 drop

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle except
swift and sorlets which is exception approved in this goal.

Somehow this repo is left to remove the py2.7 requirement
and setup.cfg file cleanup.

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Also drop the stable/queens|rocky py2 jobs because octavia-tempest-plugin master
code cannot test them because of py2 drop. They are also Extended Maintainance
state so it is ok to not test them on master. Same way Tempest and other
plugins did
- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722183/

Change-Id: I9b20229a25dc9752e4a813709f0b67bbd104faa5

subject: Do not assert heat is not None
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 8833, 'name': 'Rabi Mishra', 'email': 'ramishra@redhat.com', 'username': 'rabi'}, {'_account_id': 18002, 'name': 'John Fulton', 'email': 'fulton@redhat.com', 'username': 'fultonj'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-04-28 22:05:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-04-28 22:06:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

When testing https://review.opendev.org/#/c/719462/ I run into 

 http://paste.openstack.org/show/792842/

Unless I include this change.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-04-28 22:10:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I am testing this https://review.opendev.org/#/c/719462 by running

 openstack overcloud roles generate Controller ComputeHCI -o ~/derive_roles.yaml

 openstack overcloud -vvv deploy \
         --stack $STACK \
         --templates /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/ \
         -r ~/derive_roles.yaml \
         -p /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/plan-samples/plan-environment-derived-params.yaml \
...

So I'm using Heat but Ansible is running it because of the recent changes like:

https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-ansible/blob/0b9c6839ada2df16a6b7435b26e7589d19f79f3a/tripleo_ansible/playbooks/cli-deploy-deployment-plan.yaml#L89-L95"}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-04-29 03:02:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-04-29 03:09:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Do we've a error traceback or something? It's not expected to work when you want valid roles with heat passed as None. May be you've to set the valid:false when calling that module."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-04-29 04:23:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-04-29 21:42:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-04-29 22:05:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)

Actually this _did_ work for me. Thanks Rabi. I'll abandon this patch and then comment further in in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/719462/13/tripleo_ansible/ansible_plugins/modules/tripleo_get_role_list.py"}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-04-29 22:06:11.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Not needed. Instead we should just update
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/719462/13/tripleo_ansible/ansible_plugins/modules/tripleo_get_role_list.py'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-28 22:05:29.000000000', 'message': 'Do not assert heat is not None

There are valid cases where this assertion breaks a deployment.
E.g. running the new ansible-based derived paramters playbook.

Change-Id: I1a50e77479dfe19c7fe1d153330d09515cd12a72
'}]
commit_message:
Do not assert heat is not None

There are valid cases where this assertion breaks a deployment.
E.g. running the new ansible-based derived paramters playbook.

Change-Id: I1a50e77479dfe19c7fe1d153330d09515cd12a72

commit_message:
Remove the stable rocky from supported branch in Tempest master

Rocky is in Extended Maintainance state now so we can
remove this from supported branch and also remove its
jobs to run on master gate.

-https://releases.openstack.org/

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722186/

commit_message:
[devstack][ci] Stop requiring g-reg service

When using manila's devstack plugin, we pull down
the latest manila testing image created with the
manila-image-elements project, and upload it to the
stack's Glance/Image service.

Glance's V2 API no longer needs g-reg which was a
legacy database proxy service for the older glance
API. Our devstack plugin should not have a hard
dependency on this service.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-May/094773.html
[2] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/glance-specs/specs/newton/approved/glance/deprecate-registry.html

Change-Id: I58603032fb215ac0be2f76c8cd9fbce775be41dd
Closes-Bug: #1859847

commit_message:
Change in hvac.Client post response type

The hvac.Client post response is no longer an object with status_code and json
encoded data. It is a dictionary.

Close-Bug: #1871981

commit_message:
move neutron only common constants to private module

Almost all of neutron.common.constants is rehomed into
neutron_lib.constants now and as per the discussion in [1] it seems
most folks think the remaining constants should stay in neutron as they
are only used internally within neutron.

This patch moves the neutron only neutron.common.constants into a
private neutron.common._constants. The former will be removed once we
consume the final constants from neutron-lib.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/647807/

Change-Id: I2d65f8fcfa08984ccf60c4d023f9a9d72b89d79c
(cherry picked from commit fb6094fe8ddf6e201938c028c4bf29c472e4a465)

subject: Add ignore_errors in the ir plugin playbook
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6683, 'name': 'Pavel Sedlák', 'email': 'psedlak@redhat.com', 'username': 'psedlak'}, {'_account_id': 9592, 'name': 'wes hayutin', 'email': 'whayutin@redhat.com', 'username': 'weshayutin'}, {'_account_id': 10969, 'name': 'Shnaidman Sagi (Sergey)', 'display_name': 'Shnaidman Sagi', 'email': 'sshnaidm@redhat.com', 'username': 'sergsh'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24162, 'name': 'Sorin Sbârnea', 'display_name': 'zbr', 'email': 'ssbarnea@redhat.com', 'username': 'ssbarnea', 'status': 'do not feed the troll 🥕'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-29 15:19:20.000000000', 'message': "Add ignore_errors in the ir plugin playbook

Plugin's main playbook must continue in execution, no matter what,
so the whole playbook should ignore errors.

More background info: not all tasks of the role are ignoring errors,
which has caused an issue in the situation when the networking got
broken suddenly and ansible lost connection to the nodes while executing
the role -> after the connection got lost, tasks started failing and when
one of the tasks not ignoring errors failed, the whole playbook failed
which resulted in not calling the other half of the plugin's playbook,
which is responsible for publishing ...

Anyway, the role is supposed to gather as much as possible, so no matter
errors, all the tasks within it should be executed.

The patch adds ignore_errors in ir plugin's playbook, which shields
ir plugin from any errors and provides execution of all the tasks when
running the as infrared plugin.

Change-Id: Ib70a4b72fbed2eda730eb279e175107846fffeec
"}]
commit_message:
Add ignore_errors in the ir plugin playbook

Plugin's main playbook must continue in execution, no matter what,
so the whole playbook should ignore errors.

More background info: not all tasks of the role are ignoring errors,
which has caused an issue in the situation when the networking got
broken suddenly and ansible lost connection to the nodes while executing
the role -> after the connection got lost, tasks started failing and when
one of the tasks not ignoring errors failed, the whole playbook failed
which resulted in not calling the other half of the plugin's playbook,
which is responsible for publishing ...

Anyway, the role is supposed to gather as much as possible, so no matter
errors, all the tasks within it should be executed.

The patch adds ignore_errors in ir plugin's playbook, which shields
ir plugin from any errors and provides execution of all the tasks when
running the as infrared plugin.

Change-Id: Ib70a4b72fbed2eda730eb279e175107846fffeec

commit_message:
Added fail-safe test about file collection

Assures that the files expected to be collected where indeed
collected.

This should avoid accidental regression where we may wrongly assume
that we collected files or we collected empty files that where
never expected to be empty.

Change-Id: I13717eaa7dbb7dd42569c26d9ad13dbf0d40062f

commit_message:
Hacking: enforce usage of autospec=True in tests

Using autospec ensures that mocked functions are called with correct
arguments, so it's highly desired to have it.

Change-Id: Ia0e4ca965fc7309b435c565852a0fa81112d3e45

commit_message:
WIP Add API tests for tls_ciphers for listener

Added API tests for tls_ciphers on listener. The tls_ciphers option
allows configuring which ciphers a listener is allowed to use over
TLS.

Change-Id: Ib52e98973c7a39a1fe5f75d300e09a5bbca3d8ce
Co-authored-by: Steven Glasford <stevenglasford@gmail.com>
Story: 2006627
Task: 37179

commit_message:
Check import order

Restore pep 8check for import order.
Set flake8-import-order version to 0.17.1
Full py3 compatible version.
Add all Python3 modules to stdlib list.
Also includes fix to an enum34 dependency bug.

Change-Id: I989a84e362a18225c6f79580b22bb028d3e265ff
